Title: Research Scientist
Description:
Research ScientistFull-time positionBarcelona, SpainWe are Zoundream, a dynamic, growing, and ambitious startup developing the world's most advanced technology for infant voice analysis, powered by Artificial Intelligence (AI) and sound recognition.Our team has a solid background in Machine Learning and embedded systems, and our mature core technology has already led to an award-winning product already launched in the market.

Currently, we are expanding our Research and Development (RD) team to reinforce a groundbreaking project aimed at supporting early detection of pathologies and neurodevelopmental conditions through infant voice analysis.

With ongoing projects in collaboration with multiple large corporate customers and hospitals worldwide, we are seeking a proactive, versatile, autonomous, and motivated Research Scientist to join our RD team.What You Will DoYou will play a key role in advancing and refining our cutting-edge technology for analyzing infant voice, with a focus on enabling early detection of health issues.

Your key responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):Data AnalysisDesigning and conducting large-scale data analysis research in signal processing to support product development (e.g., database management, data annotation, data wrangling).Developing algorithms and performing exploratory analysis in Python or other programming languages (e.g., R, MATLAB, SPSS) to analyze data and extract meaningful insights.Leveraging statistical and Machine Learning /Deep Learning techniques to refine and enhance technology, resulting in more accurate and insightful audio analysis.Effectively communicating findings and insights to diverse audiences using impactful visualizations.Scientific researchPlanning, designing, and executing rigorous scientific studies to support existing literature, research and product development.Writing and publishing scientific papers, grant proposals, patent applications, technical/analytical reports and posters, and presenting findings at conferences and scientific events.Promoting the dissemination of educational and marketing content based on science to enhance brand credibility and engagement.Establishing and managing the Scientific Advisory Board, including recruiting members, organizing events, and facilitating meetings to drive collaboration.Clinical researchEngaging in proactive collaboration with hospitals, research institutions, healthcare providers, regulatory bodies, and consultants (e.g., FDA, CRO) to promote research initiatives and ensure the successful execution of clinical trials.Ensuring strict adherence to regulatory, ethical, and quality assurance guidelines, as well as global standards and compliance processes throughout clinical trials and medical device development (e.g., GDPR, ISO, QMS, GCP).Designing and managing clinical trials, including the preparation and oversight of associated documentation and processes (e.g., protocols, informed consent forms, patient safety measures, IRB guidelines).Overseeing and monitoring the progress and quality of multicentric clinical trials using EDC tools such as Castor or REDCap.Collaborating cross-functionally with data scientists, engineers, software developers, and external partners to align research objectives with product development goals.Participating in scientific and industry events to identify emerging research trends and explore potential partnerships that facilitate the successful integration of our technology into healthcare systems.Which Skills Are We Looking ForResearch Technical Expertise:Master's degree in Bioengineering, Neuroscience, Neuropsychology, Biostatistics, Data Science or related fields.

PhD is a plus.At least 5 years of experience in a similar position.Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is required.Advanced experience in signal processing (audio, video, EEG, NIRS and/or eye tracking analysis).Strong proficiency in Python, MATLAB, R, or similar tools, and experience with statistics, ML and DL frameworks.Experience with large-scale data management, data annotation and data analysis projects.Skill in interpreting scientific data, identifying patterns crucial for clinical research and innovation, and communicating findings.Strategic thinking to assess potential research trends and partnerships that align with Zoundream's long-term objectives.Strong skills in meticulously drafting clinical and scientific documentation adhering to scientific standards.Clinical Knowledge (desirable) :Ability to autonomously and reliably handle ambitious research projects and clinical studies, with strong skills in communication and collaboration with third parties, especially in a multicentric clinical trial or hospital settings.Experience in preparing regulatory and compliant reports and documentation, clinical protocols, informed consents, and statistical analysis plans, among others.Desirable background in medical device technology.

Familiarity with industry standards (e.g., FDA regulations, CE marking) is a plus.Innovative thinking with a track record of proposing and executing new ideas in healthcare or medical device integration.What Type of Person You AreHighly self-motivated and proactive, always looking for new tasks and challenges, bringing enthusiasm and inspiration with a solution-driven approach.Autonomous, organized and able to work with minimal guidance, ensuring deadlines, with strong attention to detail and a structured mindset.Ambition attitude with effective multitasking and time management skills.Adaptable to change, versatile and excited to embrace risks and disruption in a dynamic environment.Eager to embrace startup culture and thrilled to contribute to the success of innovative, high-impact technology changing the world.Driven by a passion to make a meaningful impact, committed to advancing science and improving healthcare and society.Most importantly: you are a great team player and someone who thrives in a collaborative, vibrant environment.What We OfferThe opportunity to be part of a high-tech, mission-driven startup at the forefront of global cry analysis technology using advanced AI and sound recognition.Work with a passionate, ambitious, and diverse team dedicated to redefine infant care through technology.A collaborative, innovative and dynamic environment with direct influence on product development and company direction.Opportunities to grow professionally contributing your ideas and innovations while taking on new challenges and responsibilities.Play an impactful key role in developing and improving products that directly impact patients' lives and drive advancements in healthcare.A highly competitive compensation package:Salary range: €35,000–€45,000, aligned with your experience and expertise.Stock options (€10,000–€15,000) to share in the company's success and growth.Flexibility to maintain a healthy work-life balance.Do not hesitate.

Join us and let's revolutionize the future of infant care together!To Apply: Please submit your CV detailing your relevant experience, as well as any publications, code repository or examples of previous work (if available), to ****** #J-18808-Ljbffr

GCP).Designing and managing clinical trials, including the preparation and oversight of associated documentation and processes (e.g., protocols, informed consent forms, patient safety measures, IRB guidelines).Overseeing and monitoring the progress and quality of multicentric clinical trials using EDC tools such as Castor or REDCap.Collaborating cross-functionally with data scientists, engineers, software developers, and external partners to align research objectives with product development goals.Participating in scientific and industry events to identify emerging research trends and explore potential partnerships that facilitate the successful integration of our technology into healthcare systems.Which Skills Are We Looking ForResearch Technical Expertise:Master's degree in Bioengineering, Neuroscience, Neuropsychology, Biostatistics, Data Science or related fields.

PhD is a plus.At least 5 years of experience in a similar position.Fluency in English (both written and spoken) is required.Advanced experience in signal processing (audio, video, EEG, NIRS and/or eye tracking analysis).Strong proficiency in Python, MATLAB, R, or similar tools, and experience with statistics, ML and DL frameworks.Experience with large-scale data management, data annotation and data analysis projects.Skill in interpreting scientific data, identifying patterns crucial for clinical research and innovation, and communicating findings.Strategic thinking to assess potential research trends and partnerships that align with Zoundream's long-term objectives.Strong skills in meticulously drafting clinical and scientific documentation adhering to scientific standards.Clinical Knowledge (desirable) :Ability to autonomously and reliably handle ambitious research projects and clinical studies, with strong skills in communication and collaboration with third parties, especially in a multicentric clinical trial or hospital settings.Experience in preparing regulatory and compliant reports and documentation, clinical protocols, informed consents, and statistical analysis plans, among others.Desirable background in medical device technology.

Familiarity with industry standards (e.g., FDA regulations, CE marking) is a plus.Innovative thinking with a track record of proposing and executing new ideas in healthcare or medical device integration.What Type of Person You AreHighly self-motivated and proactive, always looking for new tasks and challenges, bringing enthusiasm and inspiration with a solution-driven approach.Autonomous, organized and able to work with minimal guidance, ensuring deadlines, with strong attention to detail and a structured mindset.Ambition attitude with effective multitasking and time management skills.Adaptable to change, versatile and excited to embrace risks and disruption in a dynamic environment.Eager to embrace startup culture and thrilled to contribute to the success of innovative, high-impact technology changing the world.Driven by a passion to make a meaningful impact, committed to advancing science and improving healthcare and society.Most importantly: you are a great team player and someone who thrives in a collaborative, vibrant environment.What We OfferThe opportunity to be part of a high-tech, mission-driven startup at the forefront of global cry analysis technology using advanced AI and sound recognition.Work with a passionate, ambitious, and diverse team dedicated to redefine infant care through technology.A collaborative, innovative and dynamic environment with direct influence on product development and company direction.Opportunities to grow professionally contributing your ideas and innovations while taking on new challenges and responsibilities.Play an impactful key role in developing and improving products that directly impact patients' lives and drive advancements in healthcare.A highly competitive compensation package:Salary range: €35,000–€45,000, aligned with your experience and expertise.Stock options (€10,000–€15,000) to share in the company's success and growth.Flexibility to maintain a healthy work-life balance.Do not hesitate.

Join us and let's revolutionize the future of infant care together!To Apply: Please submit your CV detailing your relevant experience, as well as any publications, code repository or examples of previous work (if available), to ****** #J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres.

Buscamos un/a

DATA SCIENTIST

¿CÓMO SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

Estamos buscando un/a Data Scientist para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data&Advanced Analytics.

Formarás parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones más desafiantes dentro de la industria del retail.

El equipo de Advanced Analytics de Mango está formado por Data Scientists, Big Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Deep Learning Researchers y Software Engineers que trabajan juntos en squads multidisciplinares para desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje automático de calidad de vanguardia aprovechando la última tecnología en plataformas de Big Data y computación distribuida.

Cada Uno De Los Squads De Análisis Avanzado Tiene Como Objetivo Desarrollar y Evolucionar Algoritmos De Aprendizaje Automático Para Hacer Frente a Algunos De Los Principales Retos Técnicos y Empresariales De Mango


Personalization Squad: Equipo al que se incorporará la persona seleccionada y que es responsable de desarrollar algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial para proporcionar una experiencia personalizada a los clientes de Mango, tanto en el sitio web y la app como en las comunicaciones por email. Aprovechando el gran volumen de datos de compras y de navegación de los clientes, los algoritmos desarrollados incluyen recomendaciones de productos, segmentaciones de clientes o la generación de contenido personalizado mediante IA generativa, asegurando su despliegue en tiempo real.
Generative Artificial Intelligence squad: Impulsar iniciativas innovadoras relacionadas con algoritmos generativos (texto, imagen, video, etc). Este squad ha liderado el desarrollo de la plataforma de IA basada en LLM para los casos de uso internos. Además, es responsable de impulsar la transformación que se está llevando a cabo en los procesos creativos empleando modelos de IA de generación de imágenes.
Pricing and Mark-Down Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje automático que determinen las promociones y descuentos óptimos para optimizar el margen de la empresa durante el periodo de ventas.
Purchasing/Production Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de ciencia de datos para la detección temprana de best-sellers y para determinar cuántas unidades de cada producto y talla debe fabricar Mango durante la planificación de la temporada.


Debido a la relevancia de los proyectos de Mango Advanced Analytics, cada squad tiene visibilidad y presentaciones a nivel de junta directiva.

¿CÓMO ES NUESTRO EQUIPO?

En Mango nos inspira y une nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos presentes en 118 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 80 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades, de las cuales el 80% son mujeres.

Somos un equipo muy dinámico, motivado por las nuevas tecnologías, con pasión por lo que hacemos y ganas de asumir grandes retos que nos permitan seguir creciendo y aportando valor a través de los datos.

¿QUÉ HACE UN DATA SCIENTIST EN MANGO?

Como Data Scientist formarás parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. Trabajarás desarrollando soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial desarrolladas con modelos de datos y algoritmos de última generación. Estos productos de datos permiten casos de uso muy innovadores en el espacio del retail, como la geoanalítica, la robotización, la personalización omnicanal, la tienda conectada, la visión por ordenador, el consumidor 360º y las decisiones en tiempo real.

En tu día a día…


Realizarás el desarrollo de algoritmos avanzados de aprendizaje automático para mejorar nuestros procesos y decisiones comerciales principales.
Trabajarás con un sólido enfoque de ingeniería (por ejemplo, integración continua, automatización de pruebas, etc.) en un sólido equipo de ingenieros de datos y científicos de datos.
Utilizarás Spark para escalar tus modelos y aprovecharás las herramientas de MLOps para desplegarlos en producción.
Interactuarás con las partes interesadas del negocio para asegurar la alineación y la adopción adecuadas; y participarás en la entrega del proyecto de principio a fin.
Trabajarás con un enfoque rápido e iterativo en nuevas ideas y pruebas de conceptos.
Estarás conectado a los últimos desarrollos en Data Science y MLOps e invertirás tiempo en traer nuevas tecnologías y mejores prácticas a Mango.


¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?


Al menos 4 años de experiencia como Data Scientist.
Grado o Máster en Ciencias de Datos, Inteligencia artificial, Informática, Matemáticas, u otros campos cuantitativos.
Al menos 4 años de experiencia desarrollando en Python, u otro lenguaje orientado a objetos.
Experiencia desarrollando en PySpark para procesar grandes volúmenes de información de manera eficiente.
Experiencia desarrollando modelos matemáticos y algoritmos predictivos (modelos supervisados y no supervisados, clustering, redes neuronales, etc.).
Experiencia desarrollando soluciones de machine learning end-to-end, desde la fase de prototipo hasta la puesta en producción y mantenimiento.
Experiencia trabajando con servicios Cloud (por ejemplo, AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) y en entornos con computación distribuida.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación oral y escrita, capaces de explicar conceptos técnicos a audiencias no técnicas y colaborar efectivamente con equipos multidisciplinarios.
Se valora positivamente tener experiencia en el desarrollo e implementación de soluciones con modelos de IA generativa como GPT-4 o similares, incluyendo técnicas como Prompt Engineering y Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
Se valora positivamente tener experiencia en el uso de librerías enfocadas a Deep Learning como Tensorflow o PyTorch.
Se valora muy positivamente el interés en buenas prácticas de programación y desarrollo de software: tests, automatizaciones, construyas pipelines en CI, etc.
Persona comprometida, proactiva, curiosa, con ganas de innovar, y una mentalidad hands-on.


¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?


Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.
Ofrecemos horario flexible (puedes entrar de 8 a 9.30 y salir de 17 a 18.30) con jornada intensiva todos los viernes (puedes entrar de 8 a 9 y salir de 14 a 15) y la mayoría de las vigilias de festivos
Nuestras oficinas se encuentran en Palau- Solita i Plegamans.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.
35% de descuento en todas nuestras líneas
Te podrás formar a nivel técnico en plataformas como O'Reilly, entre otras, así como en idiomas, y en habilidades para tu desarrollo personal. Te acompañamos para que sigas creciendo a nivel profesional y personal!
Política de referrals, podrás participar en la incorporación de talento a nuestros equipos, ¡y te recompensaremos por ello!
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales
Servicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, así como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libre
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings
Paquete de retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería.
Servicio médico propio en las instalaciones de la central.
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad
Ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso, trabajarás con un gran equipo que va en la misma dirección para conseguir los mejores resultados
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo


You got it?

We like you!

Title: Data Scientist - Product Analyst I Logistics (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the development of logistics features, quantifying the impact that they might bring to the company, supporting the design process with data to make decisions, coordinating the rollout of features, and measuring their impact.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with product and operations teams to define the product roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (A/B test, multivariate test, clustering, supervised learning, etc) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate product questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Owning everything analytics end to end in the product development cycle, from ideation and opportunity sizing, to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Experience with an application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insights
Excellent SQL skills and experience applying those on-the-job; you know how to join multiple tables, you know how and when to use CTEs, and you use aggregate functions to come up with relevant statistics
Solid proficiency in programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

  • 🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Data Science Python Developer
Description:
Job Description

In this role, you will:


Improve our internal Python library used for model deployments by adding new features, cleaning up code, optimizing performance, and expanding unit testing.
Develop our Optimization Library from a proof of concept to a fully standardized tool for deploying optimization.
Standardize and streamline the data pipelines used for our forecast models.


Responsibilities


Develop a detailed plan for refactoring/optimizing the code in Python while ensuring its functionality and performance are maintained
Write well-structured, efficient, and maintainable Python code, following best practices and company coding standards
Thoroughly test the new Python code, identify and resolve any bugs or issues, and ensure the results are consistent with the original implementation
Create clear documentation for the migrated Python code including comments, user guides, and technical specifications
Standardize and streamline the data pipelines used for our forecast models in PAT while defining and recommending the team best practices.
Communicate progress and challenges effectively with the project team and stakeholders


Required Skills


A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, or a related field
At least 8 years of experience in a related role
Knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and best practices in software development
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with production grade python code
Deep knowledge of Python libraries such as Scikit-learn, PySpark, NumPy, Pandas
Familiarity with Python’s unit testing framework (currently using pytest)
Experience collaborating and using Github
Excellent comm unication and teamwork skills, with a strong attention to detail
Prior experience working with Databricks


Preferred Skills


Prior experience with operationalization of ML models
Prior experience with ML models and collaborating with DS teams.
Familiarity with R programming language. This role might require to migrate some R code to Python/PySpark.
Experience with production grade pipelines and ideally with Databricks Delta Live tables or any other declarative pipelines
Knowledge of pricing algorithms and demand forecasting models
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Clarivate is expanding its Data Science team and looking for a talented Senior Data Scientist to join us in Barcelona.

If you're passionate about advancing knowledge search and discovery, this is your chance to make an impact. You'll develop cutting-edge machine learning and AI models to enhance the user experience for customers in the intellectual property and science domains.

Our mission? To empower researchers and professionals to unlock new insights, maximize their potential, and drive meaningful innovation.

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments


An advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Technology, or Engineering, or equivalent work experience.
5+ years of industry experience, including applying ML and NLP in real-world scenarios.
Excellent analytical and Python programming skills (Java and R are a plus)
Experience in Computer Vision
Effective communicator and presenter, skilled at connecting with stakeholders, gathering insights, and conveying complex ideas.
Ability to rapidly test, adapt, and implement methods—from data extraction to validation.


It would be great if you also had . . .


Experience with search engines, classification algorithm, recommendation systems and relevance evaluation.
Hands-on experience in Building and deploying ML pipelines.
Background in NLP solutions for he legal domain, experience in patents is a plus.
Master's or PhD with focus on AI/ML.


What will you be doing in this role?

You will research and implement ML and NLP solutions to enhance user experience in Intellectual Property data and products, with a strong focus on the patent domain. This includes identifying and validating algorithms, exploring data for insights, recommending new data sources, and uncovering innovative applications of ML and NLP within Clarivate’s extensive content and datasets.

Product you will be developing

We are working on a wide range of products involving search, predictive and other analytics, as well as decision support. You’ll be helping out with new, state of the art solutions to improve the tools that help both internal and external customers drive innovation at major companies. Your main focus will be taking existing patent drafting software to the next level with all the latest AI technology.

About The Team

You'll be part of a dynamic team of eight Data Scientists based in Belgium, Spain, and the U.S., specializing in Intellectual Property data and products, including trademarks, patents, and case law. As part of a larger Data Science, Search, and Content group of 100+ professionals (including 40+ Data Scientists and ML Engineers), we collaborate closely with Product, Sales, Marketing, and Operations teams to maximize customer value. With experienced Principal Data Scientists on board, we provide strong mentorship and growth opportunities. While many of our projects are driven by customer needs, we also explore new technologies and develop proof-of-concept solutions to showcase their business impact.

Hours of Work

This is a Full-Time permanent role, in Barcelona – Spain (40 working hours per week)

Hybrid working model, 2-3 days per week from our Office, near Sagrada Familia, central region in the city.

What We Can Offer You


An opportunity to have a real impact on the global IP industry.
30 working days of vacation
Volunteering community, with 40 paid hours of volunteering time
Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.
Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten, and transport cards).


At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Insights (Payments)
Description:
We power people's progress.

At Preply, we’re all about creating life-changing learning experiences. We help people discover the magic of the perfect tutor, craft a personalized learning journey, and stay motivated to keep growing. Our approach is human-led, tech-enabled - and it’s creating real impact. So far, 90,000 tutors have delivered over 20 million lessons to learners in more than 175 countries. Every Preply lesson sparks change, fuels ambition, and drives progress that matters.

Meet the team!

At Preply, data is at the heart of every decision we make. We run hundreds of A/B tests to continually optimize our product, each with its own analytical and tracking challenges. The complexity of our subscription model, along with the unique dynamics of tutor-learner interactions, offer an exciting opportunity for those looking to make a real impact.

As a Data Scientist for the Payments Operations (PayOps) team, you will play a crucial role in optimizing our payments ecosystem and driving our monetization strategy forward. Embedded within a cross-functional squad, you’ll collaborate closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, and other key stakeholders to deliver data-driven insights that shape business decisions. Your work will focus on analyzing and improving payment workflows, including checkouts, pay-ins, and payouts, to ensure a seamless experience for our students and tutors alike.

Our Data Team is dedicated to empowering top-quality decision-making. Do you want to know how? Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!

What You’ll Be Doing


Analyze data related to payment processes, including pay-ins and payouts, to uncover insights and identify opportunities for optimization.
Monitor transaction performance to detect and troubleshoot anomalies in payment flows (e.g., failed transactions, latency issues, fraud patterns).
Collaborate with product, engineering, and finance teams to improve payment flows, reduce transaction failures, and optimize processing times.
Provide payment performance deep-dives per region to detect optimizations / opportunities.
Conduct A/B tests analysis to evaluate the impact of changes in payment flows.
Provide actionable insights to reduce costs, increase payment success rates, and improve user satisfaction with payment-related services.
Identify trends and opportunities, providing actionable insights to support team initiatives.
Stay updated on industry trends, payment technologies, and competitive practices to inform strategic decisions.


What You Need To Succeed


At least 5 years' experience in Data Science, focusing on data analytics for product or payment teams.
Previous experience in a dynamic technology environment, preferably within payments, e-commerce, or the fintech space.
Proven ability to work with product teams, run A/B tests, and identify product and payment optimization opportunities.
Strong background in quantitative fields (e.g., statistics, mathematics).
Proficiency in one or more programming languages (e.g., SQL, Python).
An outcome-driven approach with a passion for problem-solving and exploring new ideas.
A creative mindset with a proactive attitude, along with stakeholder management and influencing skills;
Ability to create clear, insightful reports and dashboards.
Fluency in English and eager to work on a global product with a multicultural team.


Nice To Have


Familiarity with payment gateways, transaction processing, digital wallet systems and PSD2 or regional regulations.
Experience with Looker, Amplitude, Snowflake.
Experience with advanced statistical modeling, predictive analytics or machine learning.
Experience in digital businesses and checkout steps (B2B, B2C, B2B2C).


Why You’ll Love It At Preply


An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).


Our Principles


Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.


Show more

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Overview

Assists with the conceptualization, development and implementation of an enterprise architecture which supports future IQVIA systems, products and platforms and satisfies business product strategy.

Essential Functions


Assists with the ongoing conceptualization, development and implementation of an enterprise architecture.
Devises and presents business cases and program release plans to senior management with priority recommendations to maintain and evolve this architecture.
Partners with business line managers, providing technical and system expertise, to synergize IT strategic direction and product concepts.
Partners with product development management to define IT strategic direction and assists in the mapping of projects to that strategic direction whilst ensuring product capabilities and process improvements are delivered over time within the framework of the IQVIA enterprise architecture.
Leads cross-functional product development teams, acting also as a senior consultant to provide system and technical advice.
Keeps up to date with technology changes and identifies opportunities for implementation in future systems.
Defines R&D projects and runs those projects in compliance with standard project management practices.
Mentors and assists lower level architects and business analysts.


Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree Computer Science, a related field, or equivalent experience Req
Seven (7) years experience in software and/or product development with a focus on architecture Req
IT consulting and project management experience.
Experienced in enterprise architecture, business information modeling, and system design.
Experienced in applying technology to business strategies.
Ability to employ consulting skills.
Broad knowledge of current technology, tools and techniques for software development.


IQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights, and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com.

At IQVIA, we believe that diversity, inclusion, and belonging empower our mission to accelerate innovation for a healthier world. We create a culture of belonging by valuing the perspectives of all talented employees worldwide and providing them with the opportunity to power smarter healthcare for everyone, everywhere. When our talented employees bring their authentic selves and their diverse experiences to work, they enable us to accomplish extraordinary things. Multifaceted thought processes spark innovation. Multi-talented collaboration harnesses innovation to deliver superior outcomes.

Title: Científico de datos
Description:
En Inkoova estamos en búsqueda de un Data Scientist talentoso y apasionado por la analítica de datos y el uso de modelos predictivos. Si tienes experiencia con R y Python y quieres unirte a un equipo dinámico ¡te estamos esperando!

Responsabilidades

Análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos y creación de modelos predictivos.

Desarrollo de algoritmos y modelos utilizando R y Python.

Colaboración con equipos multidisciplinarios para extraer transformar y cargar datos.

Presentación de insights clave a través de visualizaciones efectivas.

Mejora continua de los procesos y modelos existentes.

Requisitos

Título universitario en Matemáticas Estadística Informática Ingeniería o afines.

Experiencia demostrable en Data Science con R y Python.

Conocimiento en herramientas como Pandas Scikit-learn TensorFlow Keras entre otras.

Habilidad para trabajar con bases de datos y consultas SQL.

Capacidad para transformar datos complejos en insights claros y accionables.

Deseable experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos como Tableau o Power BI.

Ofrecemos

Un ambiente de trabajo flexible e inclusivo.

Oportunidades de crecimiento profesional.

Participación en proyectos innovadores con impacto real.

Apoyo en el desarrollo de tu carrera con acceso a plataformas de formación y talleres especializados para seguir aprendiendo y avanzando en tu campo.

Si eres un profesional con pasión por los datos ¡te queremos en nuestro equipo!

python, sql, data, power bi, ios, tensorflow, tableau, pandas, R

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Intern
Description:
About Marvell

Marvell’s semiconductor solutions are the essential building blocks of the data infrastructure that connects our world. Across enterprise, cloud and AI, automotive, and carrier architectures, our innovative technology is enabling new possibilities.

At Marvell, you can affect the arc of individual lives, lift the trajectory of entire industries, and fuel the transformative potential of tomorrow. For those looking to make their mark on purposeful and enduring innovation, above and beyond fleeting trends, Marvell is a place to thrive, learn, and lead.

Your Team, Your Impact

The Central Engineering CAD organization at Marvell is a critical cog in the wheel of innovation. Without this team, Marvell would be unable to execute its vision of delivering cutting-edge technology to the world. Our team is responsible for developing design flows that are used by hundreds of engineers. These flows are instrumental in working with top-notch technologies like 3nm and 2nm, which are at the forefront of the semiconductor industry.

Every day, we work on supporting all business units within Marvell, providing them with the tools and processes they need to create their products. This gives our team members the unique opportunity to work on a variety of projects and teams, broadening their experience and knowledge. Our work directly impacts the success of the company and, by extension, the advancement of technology in the world.

We are looking for fresh graduates ready to jump start their career in the semiconductor industry and join our team in Barcelona.

What You Can Expect


Design, develop, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code for command line tools.
Apply your knowledge of algorithms and machine learning to solve complex problems and implement solutions.
Analyze and process data for feature selection. Report findings and suggest improvements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features. Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.


What We're Looking For


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Strong understanding of algorithms and machine learning.
Experience with Python and developing command line tools.
Familiarity with ASIC design is a plus, willing to learn ASIC design domain is a must.
Experience with classic Machine Learning algorithms and LLMs, GNNs.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Great English both verbal and written.


Additional Compensation And Benefit Elements

With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an environment of shared collaboration, transparency, and inclusivity. We’re dedicated to giving our people the tools and resources they need to succeed in doing work that matters, and to grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.


Show more
HTML:
About Marvell

Marvell’s semiconductor solutions are the essential building blocks of the data infrastructure that connects our world. Across enterprise, cloud and AI, automotive, and carrier architectures, our innovative technology is enabling new possibilities.

At Marvell, you can affect the arc of individual lives, lift the trajectory of entire industries, and fuel the transformative potential of tomorrow. For those looking to make their mark on purposeful and enduring innovation, above and beyond fleeting trends, Marvell is a place to thrive, learn, and lead.

Your Team, Your Impact

The Central Engineering CAD organization at Marvell is a critical cog in the wheel of innovation. Without this team, Marvell would be unable to execute its vision of delivering cutting-edge technology to the world. Our team is responsible for developing design flows that are used by hundreds of engineers. These flows are instrumental in working with top-notch technologies like 3nm and 2nm, which are at the forefront of the semiconductor industry.

Every day, we work on supporting all business units within Marvell, providing them with the tools and processes they need to create their products. This gives our team members the unique opportunity to work on a variety of projects and teams, broadening their experience and knowledge. Our work directly impacts the success of the company and, by extension, the advancement of technology in the world.

We are looking for fresh graduates ready to jump start their career in the semiconductor industry and join our team in Barcelona.

What You Can Expect

  • Design, develop, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code for command line tools.
  • Apply your knowledge of algorithms and machine learning to solve complex problems and implement solutions.
  • Analyze and process data for feature selection. Report findings and suggest improvements.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features. Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.

What We're Looking For

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Strong understanding of algorithms and machine learning.
  • Experience with Python and developing command line tools.
  • Familiarity with ASIC design is a plus, willing to learn ASIC design domain is a must.
  • Experience with classic Machine Learning algorithms and LLMs, GNNs.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills.
  • Great English both verbal and written.

Additional Compensation And Benefit Elements

With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an environment of shared collaboration, transparency, and inclusivity. We’re dedicated to giving our people the tools and resources they need to succeed in doing work that matters, and to grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Deporvillage is one of the biggest European e-commerce companies that is a market leader in its sector.




We are handling millions of page views and thousands of orders per day. For this reason, we have to be smart with data and build the best recommendation systems for our customers.

If you want to be part of a team which is using dynamic methodologies, with cutting edge technologies and a collaborative sense, then this job is made for you!




At Deporvillage, You Will:

Implement, test and apply predictive algorithms by using machine learning and statistical models which will help Deporvillage to create customizable content.
Create forecasting models and recommend designs.
Interact with cross-functional teams such as engineering, infrastructure, product, marketing among others.
Work on projects such as: price elasticity, supply chain forecasting, recommenders, fraud and among others
Modern tech stack that leverages AWS, Sagemaker, Bedrock, BigqueryML, Snowflake, Pyspark, etc
Use Agile methodologies oriented towards quarter OKRs.




What we expect you to bring:

+3 years experience as a data scientist/analyst engineer, specially in a e-commerce industry
Computer science engineering, mathematical degree, statistics or similar.
Experience with statistical software such as R or Python for data mining, manipulation and performing exploratory analysis.
Strong knowledge of data structures.
Experience in A/B testing.
Solid engineering workflows, such as CI/CD. Test, automate and monitor everything! Ownership and commitment words are mandatory for us.
Empathy and team player is a must




What We Offer

A young and dynamic working environment.
The opportunity to be part of a successful e-commerce company with above-industry-average growth. Financial Times top 500 growing companies in Europe.
Competitive salary based on experience.
Permanent contract.
Flat hierarchy and open communication.
Flexible working hours.
Tax-free benefits (ticket restaurant, kindergarten and transport).

Title: AI Engineer / Data Scientist
Description:
🌐 Híbrido en Barcelona

⌛ Tiempo completo

👨‍💻 Nivel Senior

Sobre INNOIT

En INNOIT, nos especializamos en la gestión de carreras profesionales en el ámbito de la tecnología de la información. Somos una consultora tecnológica y digital con sede en España, contamos con un equipo de más de 200 profesionales del sector y llevamos más de seis años participando en la transformación digital de destacadas empresas a nivel nacional e internacional.

Descripción Del Trabajo

✅ Responsabilidades:


Diseñar y desarrollar soluciones innovadoras de IA/ML en colaboración con el Centro de Excelencia OneAI
Desarrollar arquitectura de sistemas, hojas de ruta técnicas y prototipos
Construir, probar e implementar modelos de IA en producción aprovechando los servicios de AWS
Explorar continuamente nuevas técnicas y metodologías de IA para impulsar la innovación


👍 Tu Perfil


+4 años de experiencia en la arquitectura y el desarrollo de sistemas de IA/ML, +1 año de experiencia con sistemas GenAI
Experiencia en Python (4 años), SQL, PyTorch, TensorFlow y otras bibliotecas/marcos de ML
Experiencia en AI Generativa
Experiencia en la implementación de soluciones en plataformas en la nube como AWS. Familiaridad con los principios de MLOps y AIOps.
Es deseable contar con experiencia en Databricks
Experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos empleando modelos de Deep Learning (Librerías Tensorflow o PyTorch). Se valora experiencia entrenando o haciendo fine tuning de LLM en casos reales.
Experiencia en prototipar soluciones basadas en Machine Learning
Marco metodológico Agile/Scrum
Castellano e inglés alto


🚀 Lo Que Te Ofrecemos

⏱ Horarios flexibles

💰 Salario competitivo + retribución flexible

🩺 Seguro médico

🎓 Formaciones técnicas y no técnicas

📚 Cursos de idiomas

🤓 Comunidades tecnológicas

🔄 Seguimiento continuo

🚀 Trayectoria profesional

Únete al equipo InnoIT, desarrolla tu talento en IT, aprende, crea y diviértete!

Te estamos esperando 😊así que si quieres saberlo todo, ¡contáctanos ya!

Si quieres conocernos más, puedes visitar nuestra web y nuestra app de Meetup:

👉https://www.inno-it.es/

👉Meetup De InnoIT Consulting En Barcelona

https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/Meetup-de-InnoIT-Consulting-en-Barcelona/?_locale=es-ES

👉Meetup De InnoIT Consulting En Madrid

https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/meetup-de-innoit-consulting-en-madrid/



Te lo hemos contado, aunque mejor vivirlo en primera persona

En InnoIT, promovemos activamente la diversidad, la equidad y la inclusión. Invitamos a personas de todos los orígenes y experiencias a aplicar, y valoramos especialmente las candidaturas de mujeres y otros grupos subrepresentados en el sector tecnológico. Evaluamos todas las solicitudes de manera equitativa y estamos comprometidos a realizar los ajustes necesarios para garantizar un proceso de selección justo y un entorno de trabajo inclusivo. No discriminamos por género, edad, origen étnico, nacionalidad, orientación sexual, identidad de género, religión, discapacidad o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley.

Title: Marketing Data Scientist
Description:
Overview

Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.

Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100's Best Companies List and we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We're driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.

At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - YouTube

Responsibilities

Keysight Global Marketing (KGM) is hiring a Marketing Data Scientist who will collaborate with team members to implement machine learning models leveraging data from sources across the sales and marketing pipeline. You will be joining a small, highly visible, analytics and operations team reporting into the CMO.

Primary Responsibilities


Use SQL and Python to build models leveraging data from multiple data sources across a multi-touch multi-contact organization-based customer journey
Explain model performance and provide recommendations for feature generation and selection to business users with limited experience in ML concepts
Build and deploy machine learning models leveraging packages like Scikit-learn and Pandas
Design reporting dashboards within Domo, our BI platform, following data visualization best practices
Identify gaps in processes and data collection to proactively ensure data quality across the marketing organization
Collaborate with fully remote teammates: communicating needs, coordinating work, and communicating timelines and deliverables across global time-zones


Qualifications


BA in marketing, engineering, statistics, economics, computer science, or equivalent work experience
2+ years building and tuning machine learning models
2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years workingwith Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent inter-personal communication skills - especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment

Title: Mid-Level Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Work smart, have fun and make an impact!




Our purpose is to guide all companies toward a sustainable world. EcoVadis is the leading provider of business sustainability ratings. Our solutions are backed by an international team of experts and powerful technology. We analyze data and build sustainability scorecards that give companies actionable insights into their environmental, social and ethical risks.




Why apply to EcoVadis? Be a part of the global sustainability change in business. Grow your career. Work with extraordinary people. Feel valued for your contribution.

Learn more about our team and culture on EcoVadis careers page.




Job Description

We are looking for a highly motivated Mid-Level Data Scientist to join our growing AI Center of Excellence team, responsible for using machine learning and natural language processing to drive innovation across the organization and accelerate positive impact on our planet and society. You will be part of the team of 25 scientists and engineers delivering solutions for our product portfolio and enhancing operational excellence.

Your global responsibilities will include (but will not be limited to):

Working with large, complex data sets to solve challenging business problems by applying advanced analytical methods as needed
Articulating and translating business questions into technical solutions
Building, benchmarking, and maintaining machine learning models and identifying data annotation efforts
Leveraging Python, MLflow, Azure stack (e.g., Azure cloud, Azure ML, Azure Data Factory) and Databricks to deliver end-to-end solutions
Staying in close contact with customers to evaluate their needs and recommend solutions that increase customer satisfaction and drive business value




Qualifications

Education and experience

Master’s degree in quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics/Applied Math, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science or a related field)
2+ years of overall experience in Machine Learning/NLP and data mining techniques
Knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms, frameworks and libraries, including deep learning frameworks
Good understanding of text representation techniques and experience in implementing NLP solutions (e.g., named entity recognition, information retrieval, question answering)
Strong analytical, mathematical, and coding skills
Strong communication skills
Any experience with Azure or other cloud provider would be a distinct advantage




Skills, abilities and work standards:

Continuous Learner – Ability to continually develop and improve one’s skill and knowledge to perform effectively and adapt to change in the workplace. Development occurs through a variety of learning opportunities, seeking feedback, and individual reflection.
Personally Effective - Making use of all of the personal resources at your disposal (talents, skills, energy, and time) to achieve goals.
Authentic - Being honest and authentic in communication, feedback and strategy.
Results-driven - Setting high goals for themselves and others. They accomplish their goals by effectively working through challenges and demonstrate commitment to the company's goals.
Creative Problem Solver - Focused on improving their practices and results. They are open to new ideas and they maximize available resources.
Collaborator & Partner - Works effectively with others to achieve shared goals through cooperation, sharing knowledge, joint problem-solving, and celebrating success.




Additional Information

Location: Hybrid in Barcelona (4 times a month in the office) or Remote from Spain
Start date: 2025




In return for your expertise, we offer:

Support with all the necessary office and IT equipment
Flexible working hours
Wellness allowance for mental and physical wellbeing
Access to professional mental health support
Referral bonus policy
Learning and development
Sustainability events and community involvement
Peer recognition program
Employee-led resource groups
Hybrid work organization (from the office or from home)
Remote work from abroad policy
Meals and Transportation Vouchers (Cobee card)
Dental Benefits
Life & Accident Insurance + Private Health Insurance
Paid employee volunteer day
Paid moving day (1/year)
Time off: 1 Community Service Day + 1 Personal Day
Summer Hours in July and August (36 hours per week)
Hybrid Monthly Allowance for electricity and Internet




Our hiring team looks forward to reviewing your CV and cover letter with a guaranteed response to every application. A new job with purpose awaits you!




Don’t fit all the criteria but still think you’d be a good candidate? Please apply anyway to give our hiring team the opportunity to assess your skills and to learn more about what you could bring to EcoVadis. We’re interested in hiring capable people, regardless of professional and educational background.




Can the hiring process be adjusted to suit my needs? Yes. We want everyone going through the hiring process with EcoVadis to feel confident that you are able to demonstrate your full potential. We welcome applications from disabled people, people with long-term health conditions, and neurodiverse candidates. If you need any adjustments, including the provision of interview questions, please let the hiring team know.




Our team’s strength comes from everyone’s uniqueness and is founded upon mutual respect. EcoVadis commits to equity, inclusion and reducing bias in our hiring processes. EcoVadis does not accept any form of discrimination based on color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, citizenship, religion, beliefs, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, parental status, or any other protected characteristic that makes you unique. In your application, we encourage you to remove personal information such as: photographs, marital status, number of children, religion, gender, residential postal code, university graduation date, past medical or parental leave(s) taken, nationality (instead, please state if you are legally eligible to work in the job region/country), university name (instead, please state any degrees obtained and the study major).

Our team’s strength comes from everyone’s uniqueness and is founded upon mutual respect. EcoVadis commits to equity, inclusion and reducing bias in our hiring processes. EcoVadis does not accept any form of discrimination based on color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, citizenship, religion, beliefs, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, parental status, or any other protected characteristic that makes you unique. In your application, we encourage you to remove personal information such as: photographs, marital status, number of children, religion, gender, residential postal code, university graduation date, past medical or parental leave(s) taken, nationality (instead, please state if you are legally eligible to work in the job region/country), university name (instead, please state any degrees obtained and the study major).

Title: AI Talent wanted
Description:
Join Preply’s AI Talent Pool: Build the Future of Personalized Learning

At Preply, we’re creating life-changing learning experiences by combining the magic of human tutors with cutting-edge AI. Our mission? To power progress for learners and tutors worldwide.

We’re on a quest to revolutionize education with technology. Our AI-powered innovations empower tutors, personalize learning journeys, and create engaging, results-driven experiences.

We’re seeking passionate professionals across Product, Design, Data, Research, and Engineering to join our AI teams in Barcelona (relocation available), London, or Kyiv.

Why You’ll Love It At Preply

🚀 Shape the Future with Innovative Work

Work at the forefront of AI innovation. Build transformative tools that combine human connection with AI-powered personalization, redefining how the world learns.

💎 The Magic of Real Impact

Join a team where your work empowers 90,000 tutors and over 1M learners monthly. Contribute to cutting-edge projects that deliver measurable, life-changing progress.

🙏 The Motivation to Achieve Bold Goals

Collaborate with brilliant minds who raise the bar every day. Tackle tough challenges, iterate fast, and build solutions that learners and tutors love.

🤝 Doing it ‘The Preply Way’

Thrive in a culture that values growth, inclusion, and radical candor. Together, we aim high, learn constantly, and celebrate collective success

Ready to build the future of education? Express your interest today to join Preply’s AI Talent Pool. If there's a match with one of our open roles a member of our Talent Acquisition team will reach out as soon as possible with feedback and next steps.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Sobre Nosotros

En ORBIDI, somos pioneros en el uso de tecnología avanzada, inteligencia artificial y modelos predictivos para propulsar el crecimiento de las pequeñas y medianas empresas (PYMEs). Nuestra pasión por la innovación y el marketing nos motiva a buscar soluciones creativas que permitan a las empresas no solo competir, sino destacar en el mercado actual. Creemos firmemente en el poder de la digitalización y cómo esta puede transformar los negocios para mejor. Buscamos talentos creativos y estratégicos que compartan nuestra visión y deseo de hacer una diferencia tangible en el mundo empresarial.

El Rol

Buscamos un Data Scientist talentoso con la capacidad de analizar grandes conjuntos de datos para extraer insights valiosos y desarrollar modelos predictivos que respalden los objetivos comerciales. El candidato ideal debe tener experiencia en el diseño, implementación y optimización de modelos de machine learning para problemas de pronóstico, clasificación o clustering. Además, se espera que el candidato sea competente en el procesamiento y limpieza de datos, así como en la creación de visualizaciones claras y reportes que comuniquen hallazgos a las partes interesadas. Se valorará la capacidad de trabajar en equipos multidisciplinarios para entender las necesidades de datos y presentar recomendaciones basadas en análisis rigurosos. El conocimiento de herramientas de big data y técnicas estadísticas avanzadas es esencial, así como el compromiso con el aprendizaje continuo en el campo de la ciencia de datos.

¿Cuál será tu misión?


Analizar grandes conjuntos de datos para extraer insights accionables, identificar tendencias y desarrollar modelos predictivos que respalden los objetivos comerciales.
Diseñar, implementar y optimizar modelos de machine learning para problemas de pronóstico, clasificación o agrupamiento.
Procesar, limpiar y verificar la integridad de los datos utilizados para el análisis; identificar patrones, tendencias y relaciones en los datos.
Crear visualizaciones de datos claras y fáciles de entender, así como informes para comunicar insights y hallazgos a las partes interesadas.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con equipos multidisciplinarios (ingeniería, producto, marketing, etc.) para entender las necesidades de datos, desarrollar soluciones y presentar recomendaciones.
Diseñar y analizar pruebas A/B para medir la efectividad de los cambios y mejoras en productos o procesos.
Utilizar herramientas de big data (Hadoop, Spark, etc.) y plataformas en la nube (AWS, GCP, Azure) para procesar y analizar datos a gran escala.
Aplicar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas como análisis de regresión, pruebas de hipótesis y análisis de series temporales.
Ayudar en el desarrollo de estrategias de datos y políticas de gobernanza de datos para la organización.
Mantenerse al día con las últimas herramientas, técnicas y mejores prácticas de ciencia de datos; participar en el aprendizaje continuo y en el desarrollo profesional.


Lo Que Te Hará Triunfar


Título universitario (se prefiere maestría o doctorado) en Ciencia de Datos, Estadística, Informática, Matemáticas o un campo relacionado.
Más de 2 años de experiencia en ciencia de datos, machine learning o un campo relacionado.
Dominio de lenguajes de programación como Python o R.
Sólido conocimiento de frameworks de machine learning (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experiencia con bibliotecas de manipulación de datos (Pandas, NumPy).
Habilidades en SQL para consultar bases de datos.
Familiaridad con herramientas de visualización de datos (Tableau, Power BI o matplotlib).
Experiencia con plataformas de computación en la nube (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Fuerte base en estadísticas, probabilidad y técnicas de optimización matemática.
Capacidad para explicar conceptos técnicos complejos a partes interesadas no técnicas de manera clara y concisa.
Capacidad demostrada para resolver problemas complejos y pensar de manera crítica y creativa.


Beneficios:


🕑Flexibilidad horaria
💎Oficinas modernas en Sant Cugat, frente a la estación de FGC de Mirasol.
💰Salario competitivo y contrato indefinido
🤑Bonus basado en el cumplimiento de objetivos de tu equipo
🌴23 días laborales de vacaciones + 🎂día de cumpleaños
🏠Formato Híbrido con teletrabajo 2 días a la semana.
😍Jornada intensiva todos los viernes del año.
📅Agosto flexible
🥳Actividades de teambuilding y celebraciones y off-sites
🤩Referral Program
🤸🏻‍♀️Descuento en gimnasio
🍎Fruta en oficina


Si tienes una pasión por el marketing digital, la creación de contenido y el diseño, y buscas un rol donde puedas dejar tu huella y contribuir al éxito de las PYMEs, ¡ORBIDI es el lugar para ti! Te invitamos a aplicar y ser parte de nuestro equipo creativo y estratégico.

Title: Data Science Python Developer
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
Data Science Python Developer

Job Type - Permanent , Full time

Job Location - Saint Cugat, Spain (Hybrid - 2days weekly from office, rest days remote)







Required Skills:




A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, or a related field
At least 8 years of experience in a related role
Knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and best practices in software development
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with production grade python code
Deep knowledge of Python libraries such as Scikit-learn, PySpark, NumPy, Pandas
Familiarity with Python’s unit testing framework (currently using pytest)
Experience collaborating and using Github
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with a strong attention to detail
Prior experience working with Databricks

Title: Data Scientist Supply/ Logística (')
Description:
En BETWEEN te ofrecemos las oportunidades que necesitas para alcanzar tus objetivos profesionales. Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en IT e Ingeniería ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Firmware, Software, BI, Diseño, Project Management y muchas más. Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros BETWEEN Labs.

Estamos buscando un Data Scientist Supply/Logística para ampliar uno de nuestros equipos en Madrid.

Funciones


Desarrollar y optimizar modelos de Machine Learning y Deep Learning para mejorar la eficiencia en la cadena de suministro y logística.
Analizar grandes volúmenes de datos utilizando herramientas como Python y TensorFlow, para ofrecer soluciones analíticas que respalden la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Implementar y mantener pipelines de datos que garanticen la integridad y calidad de la información utilizada en los modelos analíticos.
Colaborar con otros equipos multidisciplinarios para identificar necesidades y desarrollar soluciones innovadoras que aborden los desafíos logísticos actuales.
Realizar presentaciones y comunicar los hallazgos analíticos de manera efectiva a stakeholders, asegurando que la información sea accesible y comprensible.


Beneficios


Seguro médico con Sanitas.
Oportunidades de formación: Idiomas, Certificaciones, Bootcamps y mucho más.
Multitud de eventos: BETWEEN Night, Torneo de Padel, Black Mamba Race y mucho más.
Retribución flexible (restaurant, transporte, guardería).
Incentivos por validar o recomendar talento.


Estamos buscando un profesional con al menos 5 años de experiencia en roles similares, que sea proactivo, analítico y tenga una sólida comprensión de los principios de la ciencia de datos aplicada a la logística. La capacidad para trabajar en un entorno dinámico y la habilidad para comunicarse eficazmente son esenciales para este puesto.

Si te apasiona el análisis de datos y tienes experiencia en el sector logístico, te animamos a considerar esta oportunidad. En BETWEEN, valoramos el talento y creemos firmemente en la importancia de la formación continua y el desarrollo profesional.

Requisitos

Imprescindible:


Grado/Máster en Ing. Informática, Ing. Ciencia de Datos, o similar.
Al menos 5 años de experiencia desarrollando en Python u otro lenguaje orientado a objetos.
Experiencia en el uso y puesta en producción de librerías enfocadas a Deep Learning como TensorFlow o PyTorch.
Sólidos conocimientos en Machine Learning y redes neuronales. Arquitecturas y métodos de evaluación.
Experiencia en prototipar soluciones software basadas en Machine Learning y capacidad para definir la experimentación necesaria en este tipo de proyectos.


Valorable


Se valora positivamente haber liderado el desarrollo end-to-end de un proyecto desde la fase de prototipo hasta la puesta en producción y mantenimiento.
Se valora muy positivamente el conocimiento en buenas prácticas de programación y desarrollo de software: tests, automatizaciones, pipelines en CI (Jenkins), etc.
Se valora haber trabajado con servicios cloud mencionados anteriormente.
Persona comprometida, proactiva, curiosa, con ganas de innovar y una mentalidad hands-on.
Show more
