Title: Junior QA Engineer
Description:
Somos Applus+ Laboratories, la división del Grupo Applus+ que proporciona servicios de ensayo, certificación e ingeniería de desarrollo de producto.




En el laboratorio de IT & CIBERSEGURIDAD estamos acreditados para llevar a cabo una gran variedad de evaluaciones de seguridad para esquemas de pago, identificación y seguridad IT.

Somos expertos en realizar evaluaciones de sistemas embebidos para garantizar que estos dispositivos pueden trabajar conjuntamente en un entorno de seguridad robusto.




Estamos buscando un/a Junior QA Engineer para incorporarse a nuestro equipo y participar en una amplia variedad de proyectos técnicos, desde evaluaciones siguiendo metodologías establecidas por directrices, hasta evaluaciones personalizadas ad-hoc para nuestros clientes, o contribuyendo en proyectos internos de I+D para nuevas técnicas de ataque, herramientas y automatizaciones.




¿Cómo será tu día a día?

Ayudar en el QA debugging y la identificación de problemas.
Apoyar las pruebas de homologación y la evaluación de la conformidad (industria de pagos, IoT, etc.).
Contribuir al desarrollo y validación de herramientas de prueba.
Ejecutar y documentar planes de pruebas.
Crear, mantener y actualizar la documentación relacionada con las pruebas.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Formación: Formación técnica relacionada con la carrera de Informática, Telecomunicaciones o equivalente.
Experiencia en el mismo puesto de 0 a 2 años.
Lenguaje de programación: Python y Java..
Herramientas: Git.
Idiomas: Español e Inglés.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido.
Jornada completa.
23 días de vacaciones y 3 de libre disposición.
Plan de retribución flexible (seguro médico, transporte, guardería, ticket restaurant).
Parking para empleados.
Contamos con espacios verdes y ofrecemos clases de yoga, entre otras actividades, para fomentar el bienestar.
Cantina con precio reducido.




¿Te apasiona la ciberseguridad? ¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo de grandes expertos?, ¡ésta es tu empresa!




Applus+ Laboratories es una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. Nos comprometemos a tratar todas las candidaturas por igual en función de sus capacidades, logros y experiencia independientemente de su raza, nacionalidad, sexo, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad de género o cualquier otra clasificación protegida por la ley.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist

Any location within Spain

Hybrid way of working




Would you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project reinforcing the management and evolution of products/projects in the Energy Sector? Do you enjoy working in Big Data and Advanced Analytics initiatives that solve real world problems? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!




In the CoE of Advanced Analytics in Fujitsu we are currently looking for a Data Scientist to continue the growth of our team and leverage our product portfolio and develop new data driven solutions to address new business challenges.




As our future Data Scientist




You will mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, and business strategies, through:




Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting, and other business outcomes.
Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.




Your profile




You have a Degree, Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field, and a minimum of 3 years of experience working within the IT Consultancy industry, a special focus on the energy sector is a plus. You also have:




Extensive experience in statistical and data mining techniques, including GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, decision trees, text mining, and social network analysis.
Strong knowledge of machine learning and advanced statistics, including modeling, clustering, simulation, scenario analysis, time series analysis, and predictive modeling.
Experience using statistical programming languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) for data manipulation and analysis of large datasets.
Understanding of machine learning techniques, their practical applications, and statistical testing methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on product development.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for cross-team collaboration.
Motivation to learn and master new technologies and methodologies.
You were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results. You are a natural team player, eager to learn, and flexible to adapt regardless of the environment.




What is in it for you?




When you join our team, we offer you an attractive salary and secondary benefits, including a variable bonus scheme. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with flexible working times, great social benefits and lots of training possibilities, and the opportunity to build your career internationally.




About Fujitsu




Since being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.




More information: www.fujitsu.com

Would you like to influence our human centric corporate culture by joining an innovative project reinforcing the management and evolution of products/projects in the Energy Sector? Do you enjoy working in Big Data and Advanced Analytics initiatives that solve real world problems? If so, we are looking for you to join our CoE in Analytics & Big Data in Spain!


In the CoE of Advanced Analytics in Fujitsu we are currently looking for a Data Scientist to continue the growth of our team and leverage our product portfolio and develop new data driven solutions to address new business challenges.


As our future Data Scientist


You will mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, and business strategies, through:


  • Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
  • Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
  • Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting, and other business outcomes.
  • Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
  • Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
  • Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
  • A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.


Your profile


You have a Degree, Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field, and a minimum of 3 years of experience working within the IT Consultancy industry, a special focus on the energy sector is a plus. You also have:


  • Extensive experience in statistical and data mining techniques, including GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, decision trees, text mining, and social network analysis.
  • Strong knowledge of machine learning and advanced statistics, including modeling, clustering, simulation, scenario analysis, time series analysis, and predictive modeling.
  • Experience using statistical programming languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) for data manipulation and analysis of large datasets.
  • Understanding of machine learning techniques, their practical applications, and statistical testing methods.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on product development.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills for cross-team collaboration.
  • Motivation to learn and master new technologies and methodologies.
  • You were born with an analytical mind and a self-motivation that urges you to strive for results. You are a natural team player, eager to learn, and flexible to adapt regardless of the environment.


What is in it for you?


When you join our team, we offer you an attractive salary and secondary benefits, including a variable bonus scheme. You will get the opportunity to work in a flexible environment, with flexible working times, great social benefits and lots of training possibilities, and the opportunity to build your career internationally.


About Fujitsu


Since being founded in Japan in 1935, we have continued to demonstrate our technological prowess and the persistent pursuit of innovation. As a world-leading digital transformation partner, our business structure is aligned with the modern digital world. We use our experience and the power of IT to shape the future of society with our customers.


More information: www.fujitsu.com

Title: Data scientist (Dpto. transformación digital)
Description:
Provincia : Madrid

Nº Vacantes (puestos) : 1

Funciones

Buscamos una persona que dependiendo del Director de transformación digital y analytics sea la responsable en la recopilación, análisis e interpretación de los datos con el objetivo de ofrecer al negocio la información para facilitar la toma de decisiones.


Análisis y conocimiento del mercado: monitorizar y analizar datos de mercado para identificar información útil y valiosa que ayude a la toma de decisiones del Grupo.
Análisis de datos: recopilar y analizar grandes conjuntos de datos relacionados con el negocio comercial del Grupo para sacar conclusiones y convertir la información útil para la toma de decisiones.
Modelado de datos: diseñar y desarrollar modelado de datos que faciliten el análisis y la presentación de información
Identificación de casos de uso y/o tecnologías: Conocimiento profundo sobre el mercado (casos de uso, etc.) que permitan identificar necesidades adicionales – Creatividad a la hora de identificar cómo mejorar el proceso
Elaboración de informes y visualización de datos: crear informes y visualizaciones claras que comuniquen los resultados del análisis de datos de manera efectiva trabajando conjuntamente con la unidad de negocio


–Automatizar la generación y entrega de informes periódicos para garantizar que la información este actualizada


Soporte en la implementación de proyectos: ayudar en la implementación de proyectos y soluciones basadas en los resultados de análisis de datos
Colaboración con otros departamentos: trabajar junto a los equipos para proporcionar información relevante y apoyar la toma de decisiones informadas.


Requisitos

Titulación universitaria superior relacionada con análisis de datos.

Imprescindible


Pensamiento analítico: capacidad de analizar y evaluar información de manera lógica y objetiva
Resolución de problemas: ser capaz de identificar, abordar y resolver problemas de manera efectiva con enfoques creativos
Habilidades tecnológicas: conocer tecnologías relevantes (Azure, Python, Data Cloud, …) y estar al día del mercado para poder desarrollar y conocer alternativas y mejores prácticas para proponer soluciones para la compañía
Habilidades interpersonales: Capacidad de construir relaciones con personas clave de la organización y de comunicación y persuasión.


Valorable

Experiencia profesional en la industria de la alimentación

Se ofrece

Contrato indefinido

Retribución competitiva acorde a experiencia y ajuste al rol

Title: Front End Developer (React, NextJS)
Description:
En HAYS buscamos un Frontend Team Lead con experiencia en Next.js y React. Como líder técnico, serás responsable de diseñar, desarrollar y optimizar aplicaciones frontend de alto rendimiento.




Responsabilidades

Liderar el desarrollo de la aplicación frontend utilizando Next.js.
Diseñar arquitecturas escalables y eficientes en el frontend.
Colaborar con diseñadores, backend y otros equipos para definir e implementar nuevas funcionalidades.
Optimizar el rendimiento, accesibilidad y SEO de la aplicación.
Implementar y mantener buenas prácticas de desarrollo (Clean Code, DRY, SOLID).
Revisar código y brindar mentoría a otros desarrolladores.
Asegurar la calidad del código mediante pruebas unitarias y de integración.
Coordinar con el equipo de producto para definir roadmap y prioridades.
Mantenerse actualizado con las últimas tecnologías y tendencias en el ecosistema frontend.




Requisitos

Disponibilidad para trabajar 1 vez a la semana de forma presencial en Castellón.
Sólida experiencia en desarrollo frontend con React.js y TypeScript.
Experiencia con Next.js, incluyendo Server-Side Rendering (SSR), Static Site Generation (SSG) y API Routes.
Conocimiento profundo de CSS-in-JS (Styled Components, Emotion) y frameworks de UI (Chakra UI, MUI, Tailwind CSS).
Experiencia trabajando con REST APIs.
Experiencia con herramientas de testing (Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress).
Conocimientos en herramientas de CI/CD.
Habilidad para liderar equipos técnicos, mentorizar y realizar code reviews.
Nivel de inglés técnico intermedio-alto.




Condiciones

Rango salarial: 35.000 - 40.000 € brutos/año
Ubicación: Híbrido (presencial 1 vez a la semana)
Horario: Flexible
Contrato: Indefinido

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Gauss & Neumann, we are looking for PhDs, MSc and BS mathematics, physics and 

engineering to work with us in our office in Andorra. We do Search Engine Marketing (SEM) 

worldwide and work for international clients. We love and breath technology and everyone at 

the company has a tech background. 




We believe that advertising on search engines (SEM) should provide perfect answers to the 

users. Gauss & Neumann creates data structures and technologies that help our clients deliver 

a perfect response to queries and provide value to search engine customers like Google or 

Bing. 




What we look for: 

Professionals with a PhD, MSc or bachelor degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer 

Science, Software Engineering, or other engineering disciplines. We search for natural problem 

solvers with initiative that push the needle always a bit further and have the self-discipline to 

get things done. We look for people that have fun at work and create a great atmosphere with 

their teammates. We value personal attitude at the very top. 




Responsibilities: 

Design SEM keyword structures for international clients 

Create predictive algorithms for bidding in real time 

Create scripts for optimizing keyword structures 

Create technologies that disrupt the SEM industry 

Data research and visualization 

Manage campaign daily operations with large clients mainly in the United States. 




What you need to have:

Bachelor, MSc or PhD level degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or 

Software Engineering or similar engineering degree. 

Programming skills (Python, SQL, PHP, R...). 

Statistics knowledge 




Other skills we value:

English fluency (written and verbal) 

Project management experience 

Natural ability to deal with ratios and numbers 

Being up to date with programming libraries 

Willingness to learn and go beyond what's necessary. 




Why joining Gauss & Neumann: 

Gauss & Neumann provides an open environment of excellence with some of the best SEM 

professionals in the advertising industry. Most of our staff holds a PhD in Mathematics or 

Physics. G&N open culture provides unlimited vacation time, total daily autonomy, private 

insurance and the ability to run your own projects and take relevant decisions within the 

company. 




Location: 

We are looking for professionals to join our teams in Barcelona and Andorra.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
Logista es el distribuidor de proximidad líder en el sur de Europa. Sirve regularmente a más de 300.000 puntos de venta en España, Francia, Italia, Portugal, Polonia y Países Bajos. Facilita el mejor y más rápido acceso al mercado de una amplia gama de productos de conveniencia, farmacéuticos, recarga electrónica, libros, publicaciones, tabaco y loterías, entre otros. Logista

cuenta con un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificados integrado por más de 7.000 empleados directos y 16.000 colaboradores, centrados en dar servicio a sus clientes del modo más eficiente y adaptado a sus necesidades.










El equipo: En el departamento de Business Analytics nos encargamos de ayudar y apoyar a los diferentes negocios del grupo en la transformación digital, ayudándoles a procesar, explotar y extraer el mayor valor posible de los datos que generan. En el equipo de Advanced Analytics del que formarías parte somos la punta de lanza en el desarrollo de algoritmos, aplicación de modelos estadísticos e IA y diseño de visualizaciones de datos. Trabajamos en una gran variedad de proyectos tales como la realización de estimaciones estadísticas de mercados, predicción de la demanda de productos, creación de motores de recomendaciones para compra online, segmentaciones de clientes o automatizaciones de proceso.







Tu rol y funciones:

Buscamos reforzar el equipo de Advanced Analytics con un Científico de Datos con experiencia en programación y aplicación de modelos de Machine Learning con un alto enfoque a las necesidades tácticas de los negocios. En concreto se realizarás las siguientes tareas:

Comprender las necesidades de los negocios en cuanto a la explotación de su dato y traducirlas a propuestas de valor concretas.
Realización de Data Discovery, siendo capaz de digerir conjuntos de datos nuevos y complejos para facilitar su entendimiento.
Entrenamiento y despliegue de modelos de Inteligencia Artificial en sentido amplio (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, GenAI, etc).
Liderazgo de proyectos coordinando todas las fases necesarias para asegurar el debido cumplimiento de los requisitos de los negocios.
Tareas de preparación y limpieza de datos: integración de información procedente de distintas fuentes, selección y transformación de variables, aplicación de técnicas de muestreo y segmentación de datos.
Creación de análisis e informes para transmitir los resultados obtenidos.
Apoyo y formación a los distintos equipos de analítica del grupo en el uso de herramientas de analítica, metodologías de desarrollo.




Requisitos:

Grado universitario en Ingeniería, Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física o similares.
Al menos 3 años de experiencia como analista de datos en entorno empresarial.
Fuerte orientación a resultados y al negocio.
Experiencia práctica en proyectos de analítica avanzada con Python y/o R, así como en las diversas librerías de Data Science (Pandas, SKLearn, Caret, Keras/TF/Pytorch, Transformers,etc).
Experiencia con algoritmos de Machine Learning (tanto de aprendizaje supervisado como no supervisado).
Experiencia en el uso del lenguaje SQL.
Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización de datos como Power BI, Tableau, etc.
Nivel alto de inglés.




Otros Valorables




Máster o estudios de postgrado en Data Science, AI, Big Data o similares.
Experiencia o conocimientos sobre plataformas de analítica como Databricks, Dataiku, Snowflake, etc.
Experiencia o conocimiento sobre redes de GenAI (implementación de Transformers, promt engineering o metodologías de despliegue).
Experiencia o conocimientos sobre la metodología de experimentación A/B testing.
Experiencia o conocimientos sobre frameworks de procesamiento de datos distribuidos como Spark.




Unirte a Logista significa:




Formar parte de una empresa líder en su sector.

Trabajar con los mejores profesionales y especialistas del mercado.

Apostar por la innovación tecnológica.

Colaborar en un ambiente internacional gracias a nuestra presencia en 7 países europeos.

Tener un aprendizaje continuo, crecimiento y desarrollo profesional.

Mejorar la calidad de vida gracias a los mejores beneficios sociales.




Qué te ofrecemos:

Excelente ambiente de trabajo y estabilidad laboral.

Tarjeta restaurante y atractivo paquete de beneficios sociales.

Medidas de conciliación: política de teletrabajo, flexibilidad horaria, jornada intensiva los viernes, en navidad, semana santa y verano, días festivos extra.




Logista | Your partner along the way all the way

Somos una compañía que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y fomenta la diversidad y el respeto a la diferencia en nuestra empresa. No toleramos ningún tipo de discriminación basada en la raza, el color, la expresión de género, la identidad de género, la etnia, la religión, la clase social, la política, la ciudadanía, la orientación sexual, el estado civil, la discapacidad o cualquier otra causa. Nos aseguramos de que las personas con discapacidad reciben las adaptaciones necesarias para participar en el proceso de selección, así como para desempeñar las funciones propias su puesto de trabajo. Ponte en contacto con nosotros si necesitas transmitir cualquier petición en este sentido

  • Experiencia con algoritmos de Machine Learning (tanto de aprendizaje supervisado como no supervisado).
  • Experiencia en el uso del lenguaje SQL.
  • Conocimiento de herramientas de visualización de datos como Power BI, Tableau, etc.
  • Nivel alto de inglés.


Otros Valorables


  • Máster o estudios de postgrado en Data Science, AI, Big Data o similares.
  • Experiencia o conocimientos sobre plataformas de analítica como Databricks, Dataiku, Snowflake, etc.
  • Experiencia o conocimiento sobre redes de GenAI (implementación de Transformers, promt engineering o metodologías de despliegue).

Title: Data Scientist - AI/GenAI Solutions Engineer
Place: San Sebastián de los Reyes, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
The Data and Artificial Intelligence team works daily to seek opportunities to generate value. We prototype, validate hypotheses with business teams, and deploy all the talent, teamwork and technology necessary to build AI-first products that have the greatest possible impact at scale (millions of users across dozens of countries) to make it accessible to as many people as possible. We build digital products based on Data and AI for the construction of a great digital sports platform.




🔥 If you want to contribute to this challenge, you have at least 2 years of experience building AI products and are familiar with GenAI solutions, we would like to work with you.




RESPONSIBILITIES




Design and Develop AI and GenAI Solutions:

Design, develop, and prototype AI-powered products with a scalable approach and adaptable to the existing infrastructure
Evaluate and select appropriate pre-trained models from AWS Bedrock and other sources for specific business problems, such as customer service, content generation, and personalized recommendations.
Hands-on experience with LLM skills, from prompt engineering, fine-tuning to retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).




Productivization and MLOps:

Deploy and scale models into production environments using AWS services.
Develop and maintain robust MLOps pipelines for model deployment, monitoring, and maintenance within the Databricks environment, potentially utilizing tools like MLflow.
Be able to apply LLMOps techniques to ensure the reliability, scalability and security of deployed GenAI models.




Data mining skills:

Knowledge of the theoretical and practical statistics techniques for data analysis.
Proficiency in SQL for data exploration and analysis.
Experience with data processing frameworks like Apache Spark (on Databricks) is a plus.




Research and Development:

Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI and explore new opportunities for its application within the retail (sports) industry.
Conduct research and development on novel AI and GenAI applications relevant to business goals.




🎯 WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Strong foundation in Data Science: Experience with core ML concepts, algorithms, and techniques.
Software engineering proficiency: Strong Python programming skills, experience with software development best practices such as Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) and familiarity with Git (GitHub).
Familiarity in GenAI: Understanding of LLMs, their capabilities, limitations, and best practices for their use.
MLOps expertise: Proven experience handling the lifecycle of models in production with MLOps tools and technologies, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and model monitoring.
Cloud computing experience: Experience with AWS services such as S3, Sagemaker or Bedrock.
Communication and collaboration: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Problem-solving and critical thinking: Ability to analyze complex problems, identify creative solutions, and adapt to new challenges.
English and Spanish: Very fluent in both languages (written and spoken).




Bonus (Desirable)

Domain knowledge: Basic understanding of the retail (sports) industry, customer behavior and relevant business processes.
Recommendation systems: Knowledge of the common techniques and metrics used for solving problems of recommendation and rankings, such as collaborative-filtering, association-rules, learning to rank and so on.
Experience with Databricks: Hands-on experience with the Databricks platform for data engineering, model training, and deployment.
Experience with MLflow: Familiarity with MLflow for model tracking, experiment management, and model deployment.
Experience with GCP AI Platform: Familiarity with GCP AI Platform services and tools like VertexAI.




🌍 THE TEAM

We're an international multidisciplinary team based in Madrid, that consists of Data Engineers, Analytics Engineers, Data Scientists, ML Engineers and Data Product Managers. Our main responsibility is to convert opportunities into Data and AI-based solutions that generate value for our customers and for all people working at Decathlon. And we work on solutions to improve the experience in our physical and digital commerce, improve our customer relationship, choosing pricing or support content generation using GenAI.




WHY JOIN US

Significant discounts on the purchase of our products so that doing more sport is more accessible for you at the pace you want.
Benefits with significant discounts in relation to health and sports such as health insurance or access plan at very low cost to thousands of gyms nationwide.
Bonuses based on Decathlon results.
Possibility of shareholding of the company.
Personalized training plan according to the trajectory that you will build yourself, in an environment that will invite you to make decisions on a daily basis and where everyone considers that making mistakes is also part of the process.
Being surrounded by people who also enjoy working together building, sharing and who enjoy challenges and sports at the rhythm of each one.
Very little hierarchical and international work environment where decision-making is highly distributed and which favors internal promotion.
Professional development plan in a company where the growth of people is the priority, so you will do it accompanied by a coach.
Freedom and responsibility. Be the creator of your own journey.
And if it's something that you like... free coffee and fruit! 🍌☕️

Show more
HTML:
The Data and Artificial Intelligence team works daily to seek opportunities to generate value. We prototype, validate hypotheses with business teams, and deploy all the talent, teamwork and technology necessary to build AI-first products that have the greatest possible impact at scale (millions of users across dozens of countries) to make it accessible to as many people as possible. We build digital products based on Data and AI for the construction of a great digital sports platform.


🔥 If you want to contribute to this challenge, you have at least 2 years of experience building AI products and are familiar with GenAI solutions, we would like to work with you.


RESPONSIBILITIES


Design and Develop AI and GenAI Solutions:

  • Design, develop, and prototype AI-powered products with a scalable approach and adaptable to the existing infrastructure
  • Evaluate and select appropriate pre-trained models from AWS Bedrock and other sources for specific business problems, such as customer service, content generation, and personalized recommendations.
  • Hands-on experience with LLM skills, from prompt engineering, fine-tuning to retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).


Productivization and MLOps:

  • Deploy and scale models into production environments using AWS services.
  • Develop and maintain robust MLOps pipelines for model deployment, monitoring, and maintenance within the Databricks environment, potentially utilizing tools like MLflow.

Data mining skills:

  • Knowledge of the theoretical and practical statistics techniques for data analysis.
  • Proficiency in SQL for data exploration and analysis.
  • Experience with data processing frameworks like Apache Spark (on Databricks) is a plus.


Research and Development:

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Job description: The Opportunity

 

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist/Consultant to join our Order to Cash Business Process Expert Team. 

Mission: He/she will help to maximize the performance of the organization through the implementation of processes for improving data quality as well as reporting and analytics tools and processes in Order to Cash. This will include analyzing user and data requirements, and procedures and problems to automate or improve data flows and systems. It will also include reviewing existing system and data capabilities, and workflow and process limitations.

What you'll get to do

 Responsibilities: 

Analyze, validate and document reporting and analytics business requirements, processes and business rules to drive business solutions.
Support technology design and re-design activities through interpretation and clarification of business requirements and processes and assess impacts of changes to other functional processes and systems.
Lead and/or assist with the creation of business cases, ROIs, and other project related documentation, as required, with input from key business stakeholders
Investigate and analyze opportunities to help improve data quality and business and reporting and analytics applications.
Coordinate, support and help business users resolve day-to-day support issues including data, application software and operational systems.
Assist and support project teams and business representatives throughout projects
Manage projects or processes with limited oversight.

 

We'd love to meet you if you have

 

Experience and Qualifications 

Successfully completed degree in Data Science, Information technology, Engineering, Mathematics or similar.
Experience as a data analyst in the use of process mining tools will be a plus.
Very good communication skills.
Must also have excellent computer skills in the creation of visually and verbally engaging reports, for departmental heads/management, senior data analytics management, and key stakeholders.
Structured, accurate and responsible way of working.
Analytical and solution-oriented thinking skills.
Excellent English skills.

 

A few things you'll love about us
An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture
A range of learning and development opportunities
An international company with plenty of opportunities to grow
A competitive compensation & benefits package

Title: Data Scientist (Andorra)
Description:
At Gauss & Neumann, we are looking for PhDs, MSc and BS mathematics, physics and engineering to work with us in our office in Andorra. We do Search Engine Marketing (SEM) worldwide and work for international clients. We love and breath technology and everyone at the company has a tech background.




We believe that advertising on search engines (SEM) should provide perfect answers to the users. Gauss & Neumann creates data structures and technologies that help our clients deliver a perfect response to queries and provide value to search engine customers like Google or Bing.




What we look for:

Professionals with a PhD, MSc or bachelor degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other engineering disciplines. We search for natural problem solvers with initiative that push the needle always a bit further and have the self-discipline to get things done. We look for people that have fun at work and create a great atmosphere with their teammates. We value personal attitude at the very top.




Responsibilities:

Design SEM keyword structures for international clients
Create predictive algorithms for bidding in real time
Create scripts for optimizing keyword structures
Create technologies that disrupt the SEM industry
Data research and visualization
Manage campaign daily operations with large clients mainly in the United States.




What you need to have:

Bachelor, MSc or PhD level degree in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or Software Engineering or similar engineering degree.
Programming skills (Python, SQL, PHP, R...).
Statistics knowledge




Other skills we value:

English fluency (written and verbal)
Project management experience
Natural ability to deal with ratios and numbers
Being up to date with programming libraries
Willingness to learn and go beyond what's necessary.




Why joining Gauss & Neumann:

Gauss & Neumann provides an open environment of excellence with some of the best SEM professionals in the advertising industry. Most of our staff holds a PhD in Mathematics or Physics. G&N open culture provides unlimited vacation time, total daily autonomy, private insurance and the ability to run your own projects and take relevant decisions within the company.




Location:

Our new office is right in the heart of the capital of Andorra, in the main shopping area in the center, with stunning views of the mountains and in a natural environment. Ideal for those who love outdoors and work surrounded by nature.

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Europe's fastest-growing SaaS company is searching for a Senior AI/ML Engineer!

You can be our perfect match!




About DocuSketch:

DocuSketch with its European Headquarters in Potsdam, Germany is European leading software technology provider for the digital real estate economy. With our product brands Immoviewer and DocuSketch, we have become one of the most successful and fastest-growing software vendors in the rapidly expanding property tech sector. Our enthusiastic customer base is located across Europe and North America. DocuSketchs groundbreaking digital technology greatly facilitates real estate companies and building restoration companies to digitize, visualize, and virtualize real estate properties. Our solutions help our clients realize tremendous cost-saving potentials, process optimization, and revenue growth.

You’ll be working in a team that drives the company's AI development to develop algorithms for a variety of different use cases. This includes e.g. working with equirectangular, phone, or satellite images to detect doors, windows, or other objects inside of buildings or finding facets on the roof. You’ll be challenged by solving complex 3D geometry problems and working closely with our labeling team to ensure the best possible data quality.




Responsibilities and Duties

· Research, train and deploy state-of-the-art machine learning models for object

detection and 3D perception on equirectangular images

· Quickly prototype new ideas/technologies to create proof of concept and demos

· Tackle unique and interesting challenges in the realms of 3d object matching and

localization




Qualifications

· Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

· Excellent math skills

· Experience with 3D computer vision algorithms

· Preferably 2+ years experience developing and training machine learning models

· Strong Experience with Deep ML frameworks (PyTorch)

· Strong Experience in Python

· Self-motivated and energetic team player with a strong work ethic and cooperative

attitude

· Excellent communication and organizational skills




Plus

· Familiarity with building big data systems

· Training very large models using multiple GPUs in the cloud

· Experience with training machine learning models on equirectangular images




We are seeking a performance-driven, high-energy personality who has several years of experience in the field. Since you will work intensely with teams from many countries solid command of the English language is a prerequisite. We offer attractive compensation, unlimited career opportunities, and the possibility to work in one of the most exciting software companies in the industry. The position will be remote in any location of choice in Europe (outside Russia and Belarus). Our headquarters are in Berlin, Germany with major offices in Belgrade, Serbia, Lakeland, Florida, and in Canada.




We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Data Science
Description:
Join our Team

Our Exciting Opportunity

Responsible for developing scientific methods, processes, and systems to extract knowledge or insights to drive the future of applied analytics. Provide thought leadership, perform Advanced Statistical Analytics, and create insights into data to provide to the business actionable insights, identify trends, and measure performance to address business problems. Collaborate with business and process owners to understand business issues, and with engineers to implement and deploy scalable solutions, where applicable.

What you will do:


Ensure data science leadership
Synthesize problems into data question(s)
Decide approach for data science
Design & perform data science experiments
Develop Data Science Infrastructure &Tools
Convert data into actionable insights
Act in external relations


To be successful in the role you must have:

Theoretical Knowledge:


Common and advanced clustering algorithms including probability density and distribution based
Convolutional Neural networks (CNN)
Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN)
Transformers
Graph Neural Networks (GNN)
Bayesian based probabilistic graphical models
Deep Autoencoders
Latest machine reasoning techniques
Reinforcement learning
Generative AI


Application of ML/AI:


Clean clustering of high dimensional data with noise
Application of autoencoders to high-dimensional data
Application of GNN to high dimensional complex data structures
Application of CNN to high-dimensional temporal data
Application of RNN to high- time series data for forecasting
Application of Bayesian dimensional networks for causal reasoning
Auto learning of network structure from data for probabilistic graphical models


Frameworks, Languages, & General skills:


Strong programming skills in Python, ability to write object oriented and scalable code
JupyterHub and notebooks
Strong skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras, scikit-learn, etc.
Ability to handle large amounts high dimensional data (knowledge of distributed data pipelines is a plus)
Good data visualization skills
Ability to work independently and be a self-starter with high energy, enthusiasm and persistence


Why join Ericsson?

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

What happens once you apply?

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

Title: Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)
Description:
Job Reference

88_25_ES_CES_RE1

Position

Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)

Closing Date

Monday, 24 March, 2025

Reference: 88_25_ES_CES_RE1

Job title: Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)

About BSC

The Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputación (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain. It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe. The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress. BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries.

Look At The BSC Experience

BSC-CNS YouTube Channel

Let's stay connected with BSC Folks!

We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research. In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured.

We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences.

If you consider that you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to continue applying for the job offer. We value diversity of experiences and skills, and you could bring unique perspectives to our team.

Context And Mission

We are seeking a highly motivated Research Engineer with expertise in machine learning, data science, or computational environmental sciences to contribute to cutting-edge research in Earth Sciences.

The selected candidate will play a key role in developing and optimizing machine learning workflows for large-scale land-use, land-cover, and Leaf Area Index (LAI) reconstruction, supporting both historical and future climate scenarios.

This position involves integrating deep learning models, refining data workflows, and contributing to predictive modeling efforts within multiple European projects, including TerraDT and CONCERTO. It builds upon methodologies established in the CERISE project and aims to generate high-resolution, temporally extended datasets to improve climate model simulations and advanced Earth system modeling capabilities.

This role provides a unique opportunity to work with an interdisciplinary team of machine learning researchers and climate scientists. The team will focus on developing scalable solutions for processing and analyzing high-dimensional environmental data. The selected candidate will also contribute to scientific publications, project documentation, and technical reporting, collaborating on research efforts within international projects.

Key Duties


Develop and optimize large-scale machine learning workflows for Earth Science applications, focusing on land-use, land-cover, and LAI downscaling for both historical and future scenarios.
Implement and evaluate deep learning architectures for predictive modeling of land-use, land-cover, and climate-related variables, while developing model evaluation methodologies, including visualization and validation tools to compare deep learning models with traditional baselines.
Refactor and modularize existing machine learning pipelines to improve scalability, efficiency, and deep learning integration.
Work with large geospatial datasets (NetCDF, Zarr) and optimize data processing workflows for high-performance computing (HPC) environments.
Ensure that reconstructed land-use, land-cover, and LAI datasets align with Earth system modeling requirements.
Participate in scientific publications and technical reporting, contributing to documentation, with opportunities to be involved in academic publications and project reporting.


Requirements


Education
Bachelor or Master’s in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Environmental Sciences, or a related field.
Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience
Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in machine learning libraries such as PyTorch and Scikit-learn.
Proven experience in developing and training machine learning models, particularly deep learning architectures.
Strong background in handling, analyzing, and validating large-scale geospatial datasets.
Experience working in a UNIX-based computational environment.
Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience
Familiarity with climate, weather, and Earth system datasets (NetCDF, Zarr).
Experience in high-performance computing (HPC) and parallelized machine learning workflows.
Proficiency in GPU-accelerated machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, RAPIDS, JAX and/ or distributed training using Dask.
Understanding of climate and weather models.
Competences
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to optimize computational workflows.
Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively in a research environment.
Excellent communication skills, with a strong ability to document and present research findings.
Proficiency in written and spoken English.

Conditions


The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department
We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures
Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration
Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement
Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona
Starting date: 01/03/2025


Applications procedure and process

All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain:


A full CV in English including contact details
A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered. Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included. Applications without this document will not be considered.


Development of the recruitment process

The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposición"). The recruitment process consists of two phases:


Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position. - 40 points
Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources. In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated. - 60 points. A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position.


The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women.

In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process.

The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.

At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes. For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact recruitment@bsc.es.

For more information, please follow this link.

Deadline

The vacancy will remain open until a suitable candidate has been hired. Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.

OTM-R principles for selection processes

BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R). This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment panels and recognizing career breaks etc.

BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.

HTML:
Job Reference

88_25_ES_CES_RE1

Position

Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)

Closing Date

Monday, 24 March, 2025

Reference: 88_25_ES_CES_RE1

Job title: Research engineer - Machine Learning (RE1)

About BSC

The Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputación (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain. It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe. The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress. BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries.

Look At The BSC Experience

BSC-CNS YouTube Channel

Let's stay connected with BSC Folks!

We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research. In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured.

We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences.

If you consider that you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to continue applying for the job offer. We value diversity of experiences and skills, and you could bring unique perspectives to our team.

Context And Mission

We are seeking a highly motivated Research Engineer with expertise in machine learning, data science, or computational environmental sciences to contribute to cutting-edge research in Earth Sciences.

The selected candidate will play a key role in developing and optimizing machine learning workflows for large-scale land-use, land-cover, and Leaf Area Index (LAI) reconstruction, supporting both historical and future climate scenarios.

This position involves integrating deep learning models, refining data workflows, and contributing to predictive modeling efforts within multiple European projects, including TerraDT and CONCERTO. It builds upon methodologies established in the CERISE project and aims to generate high-resolution, temporally extended datasets to improve climate model simulations and advanced Earth system modeling capabilities.

This role provides a unique opportunity to work with an interdisciplinary team of machine learning researchers and climate scientists. The team will focus on developing scalable solutions for processing and analyzing high-dimensional environmental data. The selected candidate will also contribute to scientific publications, project documentation, and technical reporting, collaborating on research efforts within international projects.

Key Duties

  • Develop and optimize large-scale machine learning workflows for Earth Science applications, focusing on land-use, land-cover, and LAI downscaling for both historical and future scenarios.
  • Implement and evaluate deep learning architectures for predictive modeling of land-use, land-cover, and climate-related variables, while developing model evaluation methodologies, including visualization and validation tools to compare deep learning models with traditional baselines.
  • Refactor and modularize existing machine learning pipelines to improve scalability, efficiency, and deep learning integration.
  • Work with large geospatial datasets (NetCDF, Zarr) and optimize data processing workflows for high-performance computing (HPC) environments.
  • Ensure that reconstructed land-use, land-cover, and LAI datasets align with Earth system modeling requirements.
  • Participate in scientific publications and technical reporting, contributing to documentation, with opportunities to be involved in academic publications and project reporting.

Requirements

  • Education
    • Bachelor or Master’s in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, Environmental Sciences, or a related field.
  • Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience
    • Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in machine learning libraries such as PyTorch and Scikit-learn.
    • Proven experience in developing and training machine learning models, particularly deep learning architectures.
    • Strong background in handling, analyzing, and validating large-scale geospatial datasets.
    • Experience working in a UNIX-based computational environment.
  • Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience
    • Familiarity with climate, weather, and Earth system datasets (NetCDF, Zarr).
    • Experience in high-performance computing (HPC) and parallelized machine learning workflows.
    • Proficiency in GPU-accelerated machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, RAPIDS, JAX and/ or distributed training using Dask.
    • Understanding of climate and weather models.
  • Competences
    • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to optimize computational workflows.
    • Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively in a research environment.
    • Excellent communication skills, with a strong ability to document and present research findings.
    • Proficiency in written and spoken English.
Conditions

  • The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department
  • We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures
  • Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration
  • Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement
  • Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona
  • Starting date: 01/03/2025

Applications procedure and process

All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain:

  • A full CV in English including contact details
  • A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered. Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included. Applications without this document will not be considered.

Development of the recruitment process

The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposición"). The recruitment process consists of two phases:

  • Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position. - 40 points
  • Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources. In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated. - 60 points. A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position.

The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women.

In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process.

The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.

At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes. For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact recruitment@bsc.es.

For more information, please follow this link.

Deadline

The vacancy will remain open until a suitable candidate has been hired. Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.

OTM-R principles for selection processes

BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R). This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment panels and recognizing career breaks etc.

BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
En Rovimática, somos pioneros en el desarrollo de tecnologías avanzadas en los campos de la robótica, la inteligencia artificial y la automatización. Nuestro enfoque principal es diseñar y proveer soluciones tecnológicas innovadoras que abordan los desafíos más significativos de la sociedad. Participamos activamente en proyectos de investigación tanto a nivel nacional como europeo, liderando el camino hacia avances tecnológicos disruptivos.

Actualmente, buscamos a un/a Data Scientist para unirse a nuestro departamento de I+D+i, donde tendrá la oportunidad de contribuir directamente a nuestra misión de transformar y mejorar el entorno a través de las últimas tecnologías.




Responsabilidades:

Identificar desafíos dentro del negocio y formularlos como problemas matemáticos específicos para soluciones de análisis avanzado.
Aplicar técnicas de álgebra lineal, cálculo y estadísticas avanzadas para desarrollar modelos predictivos y algoritmos de machine learning.
Experimentar con AI y técnicas de machine learning/deep learning para explorar nuevos enfoques y mejorar la precisión de los modelos.




Requisitos esenciales:

Experiencia mínima de dos años en ciencia de datos o un campo relacionado.
Conocimientos profundos en álgebra lineal, cálculo diferencial e integral, y estadísticas aplicadas.
Competencia en el manejo de herramientas de ciencia de datos.
Capacidad para manejar, visualizar e interpretar grandes conjuntos de datos.




Requisitos deseables:

Fuerte dominio de Python y/o R, con habilidades probadas en programación efectiva.
Experiencia en NLP, consultas SQL avanzadas y principios fundamentales de gestión y almacenamiento de datos.
Título en Matemáticas, Estadística o un campo relacionado; se valorarán másters o cursos avanzados en estas áreas.
Experiencia en varios sistemas de gestión de bases de datos (RDBMS).




Ofrecemos:

Oportunidad de trabajar en un entorno estimulante con proyectos que desafían y expanden tus habilidades.
Cultura de colaboración y innovación con un equipo dedicado a la excelencia tecnológica.
Modalidad de trabajo híbrido con posibilidad de incorporación en nuestras oficinas de Sevilla (Aerópolis) o Córdoba.
Paquete competitivo de beneficios y posibilidades de crecimiento profesional.




Si eres una persona apasionada por los datos y posees enfoque analítico para resolver problemas complejos mediante técnicas matemáticas avanzadas, ¡te invitamos a aplicar para unirte a nuestro equipo en Rovimática!

Title: MLOps / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
NTT DATA is the 6th biggest IT Service Company in the world with more than 100.000 professionals and a turnover of more than 15 billion euros.




We at NTT DATA Spain make the difference by being close to our clients, exceeding expectations, managing proactively our projects and customers and focusing on quality and selecting employees with the right mindset to make our company grow. The Group has the ambitious goal to position within the TOP 3 worldwide. We have been awarded Best Place to work in Spain for 4 consecutive years.




MLOps practices are both a strategic bet and a fast-growing initiative and thereby we are currently looking for a Data & Intelligence CoE LEADER. The position can be based in Spain Barcelona, even if the geographical scope is Europe. The desirable characteristics are:




What are we looking for?




We are seeking a ML Engineer to our team to take on the technical design and implementation in projects within the scope of our Data & Intelligence CoE, working in initiatives for top-tier organizations.




We are looking for a professional who brings his knowledge and experience in artificial intelligence focused on:




Defining and implementing technical solutions related to AI Platform framework/methodology.
Building AI Platforms aligned with the logical version defined in high-level architecture designs. Being a cloud-native, hybrid or on-premises environment.
Building CI/CD pipelines to orchestrate the MLOps life cycle aligned with client objectives and architecture requisites.
Contribute to the standardization of methodologies for development, training, deploying, inference and monitor of AI use cases.
Facing challenges related to MLOps practices, provide resources and tools for Data Scientist, give them flexibility for model development and robust methodology to allow its productivization, train models in an unattended way, monitorize the model performance and generate retrain alarms.




What will you be accountable for?




Your responsibilities around our artificial intelligence services will be focused on the following fields of action:




Project execution: ensuring the achievement of technical milestones in terms of effectiveness, efficiency and customer satisfaction. Identifying resources needed to do so while ensuring proper management of time, risk and quality.
Development of IaC scripts and pipelines to automate management and deployment of AI Platforms.
Development of CI/CD pipelines leveraging model development industrialization.
Development of custom software integrations to integrate external systems with the AI Platform.
Technical decision making.







Why would we want to meet you?




We want to meet you if:




You have 3 or more years of experience with AI-related projects.
You have experience working with IaC (CDK, Terraform, Ansible, etc.)
You have experience working with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.)
You have strong coding skills in any of the most well-known Object-Oriented languages: Python, Java, C#, etc.
You have worked with artificial intelligence in a startup, large company or academic environment helping Data Scientist to deploy their work in production.
You are oriented to achieving high quality results and continuously improving.
You are committed to transmitting knowledge to the entire team.




We will positively value:




Experience with MLOps tools and frameworks, either from the Open-Source community or from a specific cloud provider.
Building CI/CD pipelines in the context of artificial intelligence.
Software design patterns knowledge.
Data Engineering skills and knowledge.
Experience with model and data monitoring.
IAM knowledge (users, groups, roles, permissions, etc.)




What do we offer?




We propose:




To work on projects for leading companies in Spanish and European market.
To be involved in high priority projects with visibility to senior leadership
To apply the latest technical innovations in artificial intelligence platforms in AWS.
To attend and give conferences.
To join the team of a consolidated multinational such as NTT Data, which shares with you its professional interests and enjoys applying artificial intelligence in large companies and public agencies.
A competitive salary according to provided experience.
A career path that ensures your professional development and continuous improvement (language courses, management and professional skill training, technical training and certifications).




If you are interested or would like to have more information, please apply via this advertisement.

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Our cliente IAG is looking for a Software Engineer IA/ML




IAG is at the forefront of the AI revolution, driving innovation in ML, Cloud & Edge computing, and software engineering. Our projects span various sectors, including telecommunications, customer services, banking and insurance and leveraging the latest in AI technologies to solve real-world problems.




Role Overview:

We are recruiting an ambitious AI/ML Engineer to join our IAG technology team. You'll be instrumental in shaping our tech infrastructure, defining the strategic direction of our platforms, and overseeing their execution. This hands-on role involves leading the design and implementation of AI systems with a keen focus on scalability, efficiency, and impact.

You'll manage a skilled engineering team, foster cross-disciplinary cooperation, and play a key role in strategic planning. Your leadership will empower the team to make critical decisions and take full responsibility for innovative projects, with a strong emphasis on collaboration across engineering and business domains.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and deploy advanced machine learning models, focusing on Large Language Models (LLMs) to solve GenAI-based product problems.
Bring research concepts to implementation, creating AI-driven applications with direct business impact.
Collaborate closely with researchers, software engineers, and product managers to understand complex business challenges and deliver AI-powered solutions.
Implement scalable data pipelines and optimize models for performance and accuracy.
Ensure models are production-ready and maintain them to continue delivering value.
Stay updated with the latest developments in machine learning and AI.
Monitor and maintain deployed models, ensuring their effectiveness over time.
Navigate and prioritize tasks in an environment with loosely defined projects and competing deadlines.
Own problems end-to-end, acquiring necessary knowledge to get the job done.
Effectively manage multiple stakeholders, ensuring alignment of product development with business objectives.
You will work closely with a friendly, passionate innovative team located around the world.
You will have a key role and the opportunity to grow inside the organization.
You will experience awesome team spirit.
You will help to build, hire, and lead the dev team.




Qualifications:

Demonstrated experience in deep learning and transformer models.
Good Experience in Python, Java and JavaScript programming languages.
Proven experience in DevOps practices and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Solid understanding of software development lifecycle, agile methodologies, and lean startup principles.
Excellent problem-solving, leadership, and communication skills.
3 to 5 + years of relevant experience in AI/ML projects, with a focus on NLP and LLM.
Proven expertise in building fine-tuned LLMs and implementing the latest research techniques such as continuous pre-training, (Q)LoRA, RLHF, RLAIF, DPO, etc.
Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
Research publication in ML field




Education

A master’s degree in computer science, AI, mathematics, or a related field.
Master’s degree or PhD in ML Engineering, Mathematics or Statistics.




Languages

Excellent conversational and written knowledge in English (C1 level minimum).
French and Spanish language skills are a bonus.




Tools and Applications

ML frameworks and tools: PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face.
ML operations tools: Weights & Biases (wandb), MLflow.
Data visualization tools: Matplotlib, Power BI.
Version control systems and collaborative development platforms.




Why Join Us?

Be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation, creativity, and clean code.
Work on projects that have a real-world impact, leveraging cutting-edge technologies.
Collaborate with a global team of experts passionate about AI and new technologies.
Opportunities for personal and professional growth in a supportive and dynamic environment.




If you're ready to lead the charge in AI, apply to join our team!

This hands-on role involves leading the design and implementation of AI systems with a keen focus on scalability, efficiency, and impact.

You'll manage a skilled engineering team, foster cross-disciplinary cooperation, and play a key role in strategic planning. Your leadership will empower the team to make critical decisions and take full responsibility for innovative projects, with a strong emphasis on collaboration across engineering and business domains.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and deploy advanced machine learning models, focusing on Large Language Models (LLMs) to solve GenAI-based product problems.
  • Bring research concepts to implementation, creating AI-driven applications with direct business impact.
  • Collaborate closely with researchers, software engineers, and product managers to understand complex business challenges and deliver AI-powered solutions.
  • Implement scalable data pipelines and optimize models for performance and accuracy.
  • Ensure models are production-ready and maintain them to continue delivering value.
  • Stay updated with the latest developments in machine learning and AI.
  • Monitor and maintain deployed models, ensuring their effectiveness over time.
  • Navigate and prioritize tasks in an environment with loosely defined projects and competing deadlines.
  • Own problems end-to-end, acquiring necessary knowledge to get the job done.
  • Effectively manage multiple stakeholders, ensuring alignment of product development with business objectives.
  • You will work closely with a friendly, passionate innovative team located around the world.
  • You will have a key role and the opportunity to grow inside the organization.
  • You will experience awesome team spirit.
  • You will help to build, hire, and lead the dev team.


Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated experience in deep learning and transformer models.
  • Good Experience in Python, Java and JavaScript programming languages.
  • Proven experience in DevOps practices and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Solid understanding of software development lifecycle, agile methodologies, and lean startup principles.
  • Excellent problem-solving, leadership, and communication skills.
  • 3 to 5 + years of relevant experience in AI/ML projects, with a focus on NLP and LLM.
  • Proven expertise in building fine-tuned LLMs and implementing the latest research techniques such as continuous pre-training, (Q)LoRA, RLHF, RLAIF, DPO, etc.
  • Strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
  • Research publication in ML field


Education

  • A master’s degree in computer science, AI, mathematics, or a related field.
  • Master’s degree or PhD in ML Engineering, Mathematics or Statistics.


Languages

  • Excellent conversational and written knowledge in English (C1 level minimum).
  • French and Spanish language skills are a bonus.


Tools and Applications

  • ML frameworks and tools: PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face.
  • ML operations tools: Weights & Biases (wandb), MLflow.
  • Data visualization tools: Matplotlib, Power BI.
  • Version control systems and collaborative development platforms.


Why Join Us?

  • Be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation, creativity, and clean code.
  • Work on projects that have a real-world impact, leveraging cutting-edge technologies.
  • Collaborate with a global team of experts passionate about AI and new technologies.
  • Opportunities for personal and professional growth in a supportive and dynamic environment.


If you're ready to lead the charge in AI, apply to join our team!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¿Te apasiona la ciencia de datos y el desarrollo de soluciones analíticas? 👀




➥ Unirte a Innova, es formar parte de una empresa de consultoría líder a nivel nacional y en pleno desarrollo internacional. Si estás interesado en participar en proyectos innovadores de IA, Cloud Computing y Transformación Digital, creemos este es tu lugar. 🤝




En Innova-tsn buscamos incorporar profesionales con 3 años de experiencia en proyectos de ciencia de datos y modelización avanzada, para reforzar nuestro equipo en diferentes sectores como energía, retail, banca y más.




📌 ¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia como Data Scientist de al menos 3 años en desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos.
Conocimiento avanzado de técnicas de tratamiento y preparación de datos y analítica descriptiva.
Conocimiento del desarrollo, mantenimiento y monitorización de modelos de Machine Learning (Regresión, Clustering, XGBoost, Random Forest….) y técnicas de Forecasting.
Conocimiento avanzado de los lenguajes Python y R.
Estudios mínimos: Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Físicas, Económicas…




✅ ...es un plus!

Buen nivel en SAS y PySpark.
Perfil matemático con habilidades técnicas en el entorno de datos.




📈 ¿Qué valoramos?




Máster en Data Science, Machine Learning, Inteligencia Artificial.
Experiencia en Desarrollo de Redes Neuronales en frameworks como Keras, Pytorch, TensorFlow.
Conocimiento/experiencia de algoritmos de Optimización.
Experiencia en el desarrollo en entornos colaborativos (Github, Gitlab).
Experiencia en MLOps.
Conocimiento de LLMs: Técnicas de Prompt Engineering, RAG y Fine tuning.
·Experiencia /certificación en plataformas Cloud (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) tanto en el desarrollo como el despliegue de modelos.
Nivel avanzado de inglés.
Habilidad para trabajar en equipo y aportar en entornos colaborativos.




👋 ¿Qué te ofrecemos nosotros?




Contrato indefinido, invertimos y buscamos tu desarrollo a largo plazo.
Formaciones en plataformas e internas, y certificaciones oficiales a cargo de la empresa.
Planes de carrera personalizados, adaptados a tus fortalezas e intereses y basados en evaluaciones de desempeño anuales.
Beneficios sociales: seguro médico de cobertura completa.
Retribución flexible: ticket guardería y ticket restaurant.
Ser parte de un equipo especializado en soluciones empresariales y arquitectura de datos.




En Innova, fomentamos mucho el desarrollo del talento, la creatividad y el trabajo en equipo. Invertimos en espacios, tecnologías y herramientas para que los que componen nuestra compañía profundicen en sus habilidades, exploren nuevas áreas y se sientan una pieza fundamental.




Si estás buscando un lugar donde impulsar y desarrollar tu carrera profesional, únete a nosotros y sé parte de este equipo innovador 🤓
