Title: Data Scientist Consultant (hibrido)
Description:
More digital. More human. More Minsait

Si te apasionan el colaborar en proyectos que tengan un impacto real en clientes top y de diferentes sectores y quieres afrontar un nuevo desafío, te invitamos a convertirte en Minsaiter. ¡Únete a nosotros y se motor de innovación y cambio!




En Minsait Business Consulting nuestro propósito se centra en ayudar a nuestros clientes a acelerar sus procesos de transformación trabajando en su capa de negocio y apoyándonos para ello en la tecnología y transformación cultural.




¿Nuestra propuesta? Dentro de Minsait Business Consulting, formarás parte de la Práctica del Dato, un área especializada en el mundo del dato, compuesta por consultores híbridos que combinan habilidades en analítica avanzada, gestión de grandes volúmenes de datos, inteligencia artificial y explotación avanzada, diseñando soluciones estratégicas que generan valor en proyectos innovadores y vanguardistas.




¿Cualés serán tus retos como Consultant?




Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los especialistas de negocio para desarrollar oportunidades que afectan a sus principales KPIs.
Diseñar, desarrollar y productivizar soluciones analíticas avanzadas basadas en datos para ayudar a la toma de decisiones cumpliendo con los requerimientos de negocio.
Gestión de proyectos. Planificación, ejecución y seguimiento de tareas, así como garantizar la calidad de los entregables y cumplir con los objetivos establecidos.
Relación con el cliente. establecer una relación cercana con el cliente, entender sus necesidades y brindar soluciones que agreguen valor.
Desarrollo de equipos. Motivar, formar y guiar a personas con menos experiencia.




¿Qué te hará triunfar en ambas posiciones?




Tener entre 2 y 6 años de experiencia en proyectos de Data Science y Machine Learning, desarrollando modelos preferiblemente en entornos de Big Data, enfocados en la resolución de problemáticas y desafíos de negocio.
Tener formación en matemáticas, estadística, ingeniería, economía o áreas afines, con una sólida base en estadística y análisis cuantitativo. Se valorarán estudios de postgrado en Data Science o Big Data.
Que aportes experiencia en proyectos de data en el sector bancario.
Alto nivel de programación en Python, SQL y PySpark.
Conocimientos prácticos en librerías y frameworks de Machine Learning como Scikit-learn, TensorFlow o PyTorch, diseñando, evaluando y llevando modelos a entornos productivos.
Manejarte en entornos Cloud, siendo más valorado AWS y especialmente los módulos de CloudWatch, Sagemaker, EMR, Athena, S3 y Glue.
Deseables habilidades para trabajar en circuitos de integración continua: git, jenkins, Bitbucket.
Pensamiento analítico: sólidas habilidades para resolver problemas con la capacidad de analizar conjuntos de datos complejos y traducir los conocimientos en recomendaciones prácticas.
Puedes participar en proyectos internacionales, por lo que es deseable que tengas un nivel de inglés que te permita trabajar en este idioma de manera fluida.




¿Cuáles serán tus beneficios cómo Minsaiter?




Nuestro modelo de trabajo es híbrido
Salario fijo + bono por evaluación del desempeño
Seguro médico 100% pagado por MBC
Internet gratuito
Ayuda al deporte
Formación en skills de consultoría y sponsorización de Master.
Mentoring: contarás con el apoyo del equipo de gestión y dirección para que alcances tu metas profesionales y personales
Acompañamiento para que tu adaptación a MBC sea la más adecuada
Retribución flexible: tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte, formación adicional, cheques guardería, formación adicional, plan de pensiones, renting vehículos eléctricos.
Acciones de Team building: afterworks, eventos, deportes
Participación en acciones ThePlaceToBe
Voluntariado Grupo Indra orientado a las personas, el medio ambiente y la tecnología




¿Por qué te encantará ser parte de MBC?:




Tendrás flexibilidad para que organices tu jornada cumpliendo con tus objetivos.
Trabajarás con buena gente, brillante y sentirás el respaldo de la empresa, así como el apoyo de los managers y roles superiores. Nos apoyamos para crecer y aprender juntos.
Participarás de un plan de carrera ambicioso con evaluaciones semestrales como incentivo para seguir desarrollándote; además tendrás la oportunidad de aprender, liderar, y desarrollar habilidades con exposición a clientes y autonomía en la ejecución de tus actividades.
Este sistema de evaluaciones semestrales es transparente, conocerás desde el inicio las reglas del juego.
Cultura con claro enfoque hacia las personas, respeto por el medio ambiente, impacto social y que fomenta de la igualdad de género.
Pasión por los resultados.
Trabajarás con clientes IBEX líderes en su sector implicándote en proyectos interesantes: Agregarás valor y soluciones a las problemáticas de los clientes.




MBC, the place to be




Nuestro compromiso es promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, religión, etnia, estado civil o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
The AI&Automation team is responsible for coordinating all efforts implied to increase AI&Automation adoption across HP’s Commercial Organization, providing RPA/AI/ML solutions to business use cases.

You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, match with both traditional ML methods (forecasting algorithms, recommender systems) and Generative AI and large language models. and deploy solutions in real-world applications. You’ll be able to develop expertise in AI algorithms, deep learning architectures, and advanced ML techniques to drive innovative AI initiatives within the organization.

Main Responsibilities


Increase the adoption of AI/ML technology within HP’s Commercial Organization by finding applicability of technology in real business challenges, and ensuring adoption of the solutions built
Collaborates with AI& Automation Product Owner to validate backlog priorities and whether similar solutions might be in place and could be scaled/ leveraged.
Engages with business stakeholders who need AI/ML solutions to understand the requirements and recommend the proper solution for their need, connects model results to business strategy, and produces recommendations that match business situation.
Collaborates with cross-functional teams: data scientists, data/cloud engineers, fe/be/RPA developers, and domain experts to make sure the business requirements for the identified AI opportunities are properly turned into viable and sustainable AI solutions that address the specific challenges and can be adopted
Designs and implements models to discover patterns and predictions that generate business value and innovation. Develops and implements AI/ML models: from data preprocessing and feature engineering to ensure high-quality data inputs for AI models to model development and fine-tuning to address issues of overfitting or underfitting. Delivers performance evaluations and model validations to assess the effectiveness of the AI/ML models in our portfolio.
Communicates insights and recommendations: Presents findings, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, adapted to business understanding. Translates complex technical concepts into actionable insights for non-technical audiences.
Stays updated with AI research and advancements: Keeps abreast of the latest trends, techniques, and research papers in the field of AI and machine learning. Continuously explores new algorithms and approaches to enhance the organization's AI capabilities.


Job Requirements


Bachelor's, master's or Ph.D. degree in Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Computer Science, or equivalent.
Typically, 1-2 years of relevant work experience.
Experience with Python and PySpark Programming: coding skills in Python for data manipulation, model development, and integration with Azure services.
Exposure to Azure Services: Knowledge of key Azure services like Azure Machine Learning, Azure AI Search, and Azure Functions for deploying RAG systems.
Exposure to Databricks: Ability to design, develop, and optimize workflows in Azure Databricks for data processing and feature engineering.
Understanding of NLP and GenAI concepts: Familiarity with Large Language Models, prompt engineering for LLMs, vector databases, and Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems.
Knowledge in Applied Statistics and Algorithms: Use statistics, mathematics, algorithms, and programming to address business challenges.
Familiarity with the deployment and scaling RAG systems in production, using Azure’s containerization options such as Docker, AKS (Azure Kubernetes Service), or Azure Functions.
Ability to define and create ML models to pull valuable insights, predictions, and innovation from data.
Familiarity with popular AI frameworks, libraries, and tools.


Knowledge & Skills


Proper understanding of digital industry trends (RPA, AI, ML) and their benefits.
Good communication skills (i.e. written, verbal, presentation) and collaboration skills to work effectively within a multidisciplinary team.
Problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to tackle complex AI challenges.
Ability to work in globally distributed virtual teams
Proficiency in English is a must
Ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to ensure successful AI/ML implementation.
Team player

  • Proficiency in English is a must
  • Ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to ensure successful AI/ML implementation.
  • Team player

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¿Quieres un desafío profesional en una consultora IT de primer nivel? ¡Esta es tu oportunidad! En Intelequia, nos encontramos en búsqueda de talento innovador y apasionado por las tecnologías de vanguardia para unirse a nuestro equipo.







Con más de 15 años de experiencia en el sector y reconocidos como una de las mejores empresas de tecnología para trabajar en España, según Great Place To Work, estamos especializados en realizar servicios TIC en la nube operando a nivel nacional e internacional, abarcando áreas como Infraestructura, Ciberseguridad, Inteligencia Artificial y Desarrollos en .NET y Low Code




.

Nuestra misión es acompañar a nuestros clientes en cada etapa de sus proyectos de IT, liderando sus iniciativas y ofreciendo soluciones punteras que impulsen su crecimiento y eficiencia en un entorno tecnológico cada vez más competitivo. Si estás dispuesto a asumir nuevos retos y formar parte de un equipo comprometido con la excelencia, ¡queremos conocerte!




¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?

Un/a Data Scientist, con al menos 2 años de experiencia en el sector.




FUNCIONES

Realizar análisis exploratorios de datos para comprender los patrones y tendencias de los datos.
Construir y entrenar modelos de machine learning para resolver problemas de negocio y predecir resultados.
Implementar modelos de machine learning en sistemas de producción.
Interpretar y comunicar los resultados del análisis de datos a stakeholders técnicos y no técnicos.
Mantenerse actualizado sobre las últimas técnicas y herramientas de ciencia de datos.




REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS




Formación en Ingeniería Técnica/Informática o similares.
Valorable estar en posición de master vinculado al sector IT
Conocimientos en Python o R.
Conocimientos sólidos en estadística y técnicas de machine learning.
Experiencia con bibliotecas de machine learning populares (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn).
Habilidades de visualización de datos para comunicar resultados de forma clara y efectiva (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly).
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y colaboración.
Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y como parte de un equipo.
Orientación a los detalles y capacidad para resolver problemas.




Porque en Intelequia creemos firmemente que el bienestar de nuestro equipo influye directamente en el trabajo realizado, para ello TE OFRECEMOS:




Incorporarte a un proyecto ilusionante y motivador, que despertará la pasión que hay en ti.
Plan de desarrollo profesional para potenciar tu perfil (certificaciones, formaciones en idiomas y competencias profesionales, etc.)
Modelo de trabajo híbrido (sólo 2 días de trabajo al mes en nuestra sede de Tenerife).
Jornada laboral de 38 horas/semana.
25 días hábiles de vacaciones al año.
Tarde de cumpleaños libre.
Plan de retribución flexible para tu beneficio.
Formar parte de una empresa Great Place to Work.
Crecer y aportar junto a grandes profesionales, dentro de un buen clima laboral.

Title: Data Scientist (Full Remote within Spain)
Description:
ABOUT US



At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration. 

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!


ABOUT THE ROLE



Due to continuous growth, our Business Intelligence team is excited to welcome a motivated Data Scientist to help us align our work with business goals to drive organizational success.

As a Data Scientist, you'll play a vital role in big data analysis and be responsible for maintaining and enhance data quality. Working closely with key stakeholders, you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on both our products and processes.

If you're passionate about solving complex problems, collaborating across departments, and driving results, this role is perfect for you!



YOUR MISSION



As a Data Scinetist at Leadtech, you will:

Conduct thorough data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and improvement opportunities within datasets.
Create effective reports and visualizations to communicate key findings to the company's teams and support data-informed decision-making.
Calculate and apply algorithms to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV).
Collaborate closely with business intelligence specialists, data scientists and other team members to develop predictive models and data-driven solutions.
Perform ad-hoc research to address specific business-related questions.
Continually maintain and enhance data quality, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Participate in the identification and collection of new data relevant to business objectives.
Contribute to the evaluation of new tools and technologies for data management and analysis.
Strong analytical skills
Outstanding oral and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills



Requirements


WHAT WILL MAKE YOU STAND OUT FROM THE CROWD



We're looking for someone with a balance of hard and soft skills who can thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. Here's what we'd love to see:

Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering (Industrial Engineering, Telecommunications Engineering), or a similar discipline.
Demonstrated experience in Data Science environment.
Solid knowledge of data science/analysis tools, such as KNIME, SPSS, or similar tools.
Ability to develop, train, and optimize machine learning models.
Experience in predictive modeling, time series analysis, or cluster analysis.
Experience in calculating and applying algorithms to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV).
Ability to tackle complex problems, identify patterns, and design creative data-driven solutions.
Commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest trends in technology and data science.
Experience with databases and query languages, such as SQL.
Ability to create effective visualizations using tools like Qlik Sense, QlikView or similar.
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations.
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams.
Proactive attitude and results-oriented.



Benefits


WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?



Growth and career development

At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities.

Work-Life balance

Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!

Comprehensive benefits

Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services).
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options—no blackout days!

Unique Perks

If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views.
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary.



Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences



Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

"Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!"

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
SegurCaixa Adeslas es la compañía No Vida líder en España en seguros de salud, integrada en el Grupo Mutua Madrileña y participada por CaixaBank.




En los últimos años se ha convertido en una entidad de referencia gracias a la implantación de un modelo de negocio basado en el crecimiento sostenido y rentable, que sitúa al cliente en el centro de la estrategia. A través de su acuerdo de bancaseguros con CaixaBank, SegurCaixa Adeslas comercializa sus productos en la mayor red bancaria de España. Adicionalmente, la aseguradora cuenta con una red tradicional con más de 4.000 puntos de venta y atención al cliente.




Estamos convencid@s de que las personas son el principal valor de nuestra compañía y por eso SegurCaixa Adeslas se muestra absolutamente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades entre hombres y mujeres. Nuestro Plan de Igualdad persigue hacer efectivo este principio y por ello, el proceso de selección de nuestras ofertas garantiza la igualdad de oportunidades a todas las candidaturas.




¿Qué buscamos?




El equipo de Analítica Avanzada quiere incorporar un/a Senior Data Scientist con experiencia en el sector asegurador, que nos ayude al posicionamiento del área como un elemento diferenciador dentro de la compañía, aportando soluciones de analítica avanzada que tengan impacto real en el negocio.




En tu día a día, contribuirás dentro del equipo de Analítica Avanzada en el desarrollo de casos de uso aplicando técnicas de ML, así como en la puesta en producción de los mismos con impacto en negocio: mejorando nuestro control de costes, cuidar de nuestra cartera fidelizando y reteniendo, mejorando nuestra experiencia de cliente, eficientando procesos…




FUNCIONES




Diseñar, desarrollar y productivizar soluciones analíticas avanzadas basadas en datos para ayudar a la toma de decisiones cumpliendo con los requerimientos de negocio.
Liderar el diseño, análisis y preprocesamiento de datos, junto con los/as Data Engineer, para alimentar los modelos de ML.
Creación de escenarios de simulación y análisis del impacto esperado por los diferentes modelos en los resultados.
Comunicación con Negocio constante, para identificar las necesidades de negocio y dar respuestas a los problemas de negocio usando análisis y técnicas de modelado sobre los datos.
Seguimiento, control y análisis continuo de resultados de los principales indicadores de negocio impactados por las soluciones analíticas y de las métricas técnicas asociadas, en el marco de la mejora continua.
Evaluar y seleccionar los modelos estadísticos, reglas o soluciones más adecuados para cada caso de uso.
Participar en el ciclo de productivización MLOps.




REQUISITOS




Licenciado/a o Grado en Estadística / Matemáticas / Actuariales con máster en Data Science
Experiencia: 3-5 años experiencia trabajando como Data Scientist diseñando e implementando técnicas de ML / IA con Python y/o R
Valorable experiencia en sector seguros




Informática y aplicaciones:




Gran dominio y experiencia en Python
Dominio de librerías de IA y ML
Conocimiento y experiencia en entorno Cloud, Azure / Databricks
Necesario: Gran conocimiento y comprensión de métodos de Machine Learning







¿Eres la persona que buscamos?

En @SegurCaixaAdeslas te estamos esperando ¡¡Únete a nosotros/as!!

Show more

¿Qué buscamos?


El equipo de Analítica Avanzada quiere incorporar un/a Senior Data Scientist con experiencia en el sector asegurador, que nos ayude al posicionamiento del área como un elemento diferenciador dentro de la compañía, aportando soluciones de analítica avanzada que tengan impacto real en el negocio.


En tu día a día, contribuirás dentro del equipo de Analítica Avanzada en el desarrollo de casos de uso aplicando técnicas de ML, así como en la puesta en producción de los mismos con impacto en negocio: mejorando nuestro control de costes, cuidar de nuestra cartera fidelizando y reteniendo, mejorando nuestra experiencia de cliente, eficientando procesos…


FUNCIONES


  • Diseñar, desarrollar y productivizar soluciones analíticas avanzadas basadas en datos para ayudar a la toma de decisiones cumpliendo con los requerimientos de negocio.
  • Liderar el diseño, análisis y preprocesamiento de datos, junto con los/as Data Engineer, para alimentar los modelos de ML.

  • Evaluar y seleccionar los modelos estadísticos, reglas o soluciones más adecuados para cada caso de uso.
  • Participar en el ciclo de productivización MLOps.


REQUISITOS


  • Licenciado/a o Grado en Estadística / Matemáticas / Actuariales con máster en Data Science
  • Experiencia: 3-5 años experiencia trabajando como Data Scientist diseñando e implementando técnicas de ML / IA con Python y/o R
  • Valorable experiencia en sector seguros


Informática y aplicaciones:


  • Gran dominio y experiencia en Python
  • Dominio de librerías de IA y ML
  • Conocimiento y experiencia en entorno Cloud, Azure / Databricks
  • Necesario: Gran conocimiento y comprensión de métodos de Machine Learning



¿Eres la persona que buscamos?

En @SegurCaixaAdeslas te estamos esperando ¡¡Únete a nosotros/as!!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Expert (AI/NLP/ML)
Description:
📢 We are looking for an Artificial Intelligence Expert (AI/NLP/ML)!

We are seeking a highly skilled Artificial Intelligence Expert specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), and AI-driven solutions using Large Language Models (LLMs) for HR and Document Management applications. This role is part of the Architect Office (AO), which oversees and coordinates technical and business architecture-related activities. The position is remote, based in Europe (far-site).

📍 Location: Europe (Remote – Far-site)

📆 Start Date: Immediate

💼 Experience: Expertise in AI/ML/NLP solutions and cloud-based architectures

What Will You Do?

✅ Develop and maintain AI-powered software applications in Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML), and Artificial Intelligence (AI).

✅ Design and optimize machine learning systems and deep learning architectures.

✅ Integrate AI/ML solutions into existing products and processes in collaboration with cross-functional teams.

✅ Architect and implement AI solutions, ensuring compliance with master- and meta-data management principles.

✅ Conduct data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation to enhance AI performance.

✅ Stay up-to-date with AI/ML advancements, adopting state-of-the-art algorithms and technologies.

✅ Manage and maintain AI solutions deployed on SaaS platforms (AWS, Azure).

✅ Document architectural blueprints and align business requirements with AI-driven capabilities.

The candidate will report to the Architect Office (AO) and project managers, following SAFe methodology and sprint-based planning.

Requirements:

Requirements & Skills:

✨ Proven ability to develop Large Language Models (LLMs), text embeddings, tokenization, and vectorization.

✨ Strong expertise in Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning architectures.

✨ Hands-on experience with Python, Java, Containers (Docker/Kubernetes), and Cloud AI services (AWS, Azure).

✨ Deep understanding of NLP systems lifecycle and agile software development methodologies.

✨ Knowledge of quality assurance and control for machine translation (MT), including testing methodologies and evaluation metrics (BLEU scores and similar).

✨ Strong problem-solving, analytical, and technical writing skills.

✨ Ability to conduct proof of concepts (PoC) efficiently and effectively.

✨ Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Preferred Qualifications & Certifications:

✅ AWS Certified Machine Learning / Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate.

✅ AWS Certified Data Analytics / Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Scientist Associate.

✅ AWS Certified Solutions Architect / Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert.

Additional Requirements for Large International Organizations:

🌍 Ability to integrate into an international, multicultural environment and work in multilingual settings.

🤝 Strong team player with experience working on large-scale projects.

📝 High degree of discretion and integrity, as the managed applications contain confidential and personal data.

🗣 Fluent English (C1/C2) is mandatory; French (B1/B2) is an advantage.

Why Join Us?

🚀 Work on cutting-edge AI/NLP/ML solutions in a highly innovative and technical environment.

🌍 Remote opportunity within a highly collaborative and multicultural team.

💡 Be part of an international transformation program, driving AI-powered solutions for HR and Document Management.

💼 Competitive salary, career growth opportunities, and involvement in AI-driven digital transformation projects.

📩 Apply now or send your resume to jobs@sapindex.es and be part of the AI revolution! 🚀

Additional Requirements for Large International Organizations:

🌍 Ability to integrate into an international, multicultural environment and work in multilingual settings.

🤝 Strong team player with experience working on large-scale projects.

📝 High degree of discretion and integrity, as the managed applications contain confidential and personal data.

🗣 Fluent English (C1/C2) is mandatory; French (B1/B2) is an advantage.

Why Join Us?

🚀 Work on cutting-edge AI/NLP/ML solutions in a highly innovative and technical environment.

🌍 Remote opportunity within a highly collaborative and multicultural team.

💡 Be part of an international transformation program, driving AI-powered solutions for HR and Document Management.

💼 Competitive salary, career growth opportunities, and involvement in AI-driven digital transformation projects.

📩 Apply now or send your resume to jobs@sapindex.es and be part of the AI revolution! 🚀

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Na AXIANS procuramos o talento certo, para o lugar certo. Trabalhamos diariamente para envolver as nossas pessoas num ambiente colaborativo e inclusivo, com uma cultura de proximidade. Faz também parte da nossa cultura a preocupação com o meio ambiente e a realização de ações de responsabilidade corporativa social e ambiental.

Esta pode ser a sua oportunidade de integrar uma empresa de âmbito internacional, com um projeto que precisa de si para responder aos desafios da transformação digital.

💻 O CARGO

Procuramos um #TechTalent para desempenhar funções enquanto Python Developer para um projeto internacional no setor das telecomunicações.

💡 O QUE PROCURAMOS


Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
Experiência profissional superior a 3 anos em Python;
Experiência com processos ETL (preferencial);
Experiência com data warehouses (preferencial);
Conhecimentos/experiência com Linux (preferencial);
Experiência em GIT;
Conhecimentos médios na língua inglesa.


⭐O QUE PODE ESPERAR DE NÓS

Carreira profissional estável

Ao trabalhar com projetos da Axians torna-se uma mais valia a quem queremos oferecer estabilidade, através de uma carreira segura.

Perspetivas de progressão na carreira

Poderá aceder a formações e novas certificações que elevarão ainda mais as suas competências. A avaliação 360° dos managers e peers também permitirão evoluir.

Conciliação entre a área profissional e a familiar

Colaborando com a Axians há abertura para conciliar as exigências laborais com os requisitos familiares, evitando negligenciar cada uma das áreas.

Compensação evolutiva e atrativa

Ao trabalhar com clientes da Axians, terá acesso a prémios de performance, além de um pack salarial atrativo (vencimento base + benefícios). Também tem direito a seguro de saúde e consultas de psicologia gratuitas.

Identifica-se com esta vaga?

Se pensa que esta vaga é a sua cara e tem o #TechTalent que procuramos envie-nos o seu currículo, de preferência em inglês e em formato Europass, para recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com com o PD/AS/MO

Saber mais sobre a Axians

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
A SynchroTech recruta Data Scientist para prestigiado cliente do setor energético, localizado em Lisboa.

FUNÇÃO

  • Experiência com bases de dados relacionais e NoSQL;
  • Experiência no desenvolvimento de projetos de machine learning (Python, R ou SAS), no deployment de modelos para ambientes de produção e gestão do ciclo de vida de modelos;
  • Sólida eexperiência prévia na implementação de soluções interativas de visualização de dados para apresentação de resultados complexos. Valorizado: conhecimento/experiência no desenvolvimento de soluções analíticas que envolvam IA.

LOCAL E HORÁRIO

  • Lisboa;
  • Regime híbrido;
  • Tempo completo.

REQUISITOS

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, de Software, Ciências da Computação ou similar (preferencial);
  • Até 5 anos de experiência na função;
  • Boa capacidade de comunicação escrita e verbal;
  • Conhecimentos do mercado Energy & Utilities e RGPD (valorizado);
  • Capacidade de trabalho em ambiente colaborativo e com equipas globais;
  • Capacidade de análise crítica e focada em resolução de problemas;
  • Conhecimentos da metodologia Agile, ferramenta JIRA e Confluence (valorizado);
  • Compromisso de qualidade de entregas;
  • Bons conhecimentos da língua inglesa.

CONDIÇÕES

  • Contrato de trabalho com a Synchro by Egor;
  • Vencimento acima da média + Subsídio de alimentação;
  • Seguro de saúde + Outros benefícios;
  • Integração num grupo de renome.

Os candidatos interessados devem submeter o CV atualizado.

SynchroTech by Egor

Success through People

Os candidatos considerados serão contactados num prazo máximo de 10 dias úteis.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We are based in Estonia and we operate globally. We love to work remotely and travel the world. Having freedom, ownership and passion for recruitment are key for us.

We hire amazing tech talent for great companies

We coach highly motivated Professionals to get better careers

We empower recruiters to hire more and better Talent.

Do you want to help us to grow?

Hiire is helping CEGID, a European leader in cloud business management, hire a Data Scientist to advance the data science capabilities.

About The Role

CEGID seeks a Data Scientist to develop machine learning models, focusing on building robust models that enhance decision-making processes and drive business intelligence.

You'll be working within the AI Factory dedicated to advancing CEGID's management software through AI innovation. The primary goal is to seamlessly integrate AI features into the product line, either by enhancing functionality and user experience or by recreating user workflows to take full advantage of AI technology.

What You'll Do

  • Lead the design, development, and implementation of machine learning models tailored for finance and accounting applications;
  • Explore and develop generative AI models to address challenges and opportunities in the finance and accounting domain;
  • Collaborate with finance and accounting experts, software engineers, and data engineers to integrate machine learning solutions into existing systems;
  • Demonstrate an interest in and familiarity with MLOps tools and practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and management of machine learning models.

What We're Looking For

  • Advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline;
  • Proven experience (2+ years) in developing and deploying machine learning models, preferably in the finance and accounting domain;
  • Strong programming skills in languages such as Python or R, familiarity with MLOps tools and practices;
  • Experience with generative AI models and/or NLP is a plus.

Why Join Our Client?

  • Attractive and transparent remuneration from recruitment;
  • Annual performance-based bonus aligned with individual and company goals;
  • Hybrid work model and flexible working hours;
  • 25 days of vacation per year;
  • Health insurance;
  • Access to online learning platforms and internal academy;
  • Be part of a dynamic, innovative, and growing team.

Ready to take the next step? Apply now and help shape your future, ours, and our clients’ industries’ future!

Title: Junior Data Scientist/Engineer
HTML:
Acceleration is WPP’s data and technology consultancy, operated globally by leading media company GroupM. We work closely with GroupM agencies (EssenceMediacom, Mindhsare and Wavemaker) and Google center of excellence to connect our clients' media investments to tangible business results, powering possibilities and performance through data and technology.

We make data and technology work better for people and business!

Click to discover more about Acceleration and GroupM.

We are seeking a highly motivated and adaptable Junior Data Scientist/Engineer to join our small, dynamic team in Lisbon, Portugal. This entry-level role offers a unique opportunity to gain broad experience across various data-focused disciplines, including machine learning, data engineering, and business intelligence.

The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in programming, a passion for data analysis, and a willingness to learn and contribute across different areas.

This position provides excellent growth potential within a supportive team environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Machine Learning: Develop, implement, and deploy machine learning models. Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering. Train and evaluate models;
  • Data Engineering: Support the building and maintenance of data pipelines. Assist in data processing and transformation. Work with databases under the guidance of senior team members;
  • Business Intelligence: Contribute to the development of reports and dashboards. Assist in data analysis and identification of trends;
  • Collaborate with other team members on projects across these disciplines;
  • Actively learn and develop skills in ML/AI, data engineering, and BI;
  • Contribute to the overall improvement of our data capabilities.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 1+ year of experience in a data-related role or demonstrable project experience (including internships or academic projects);
  • Strong programming skills in Python;
  • Experience with data warehousing concepts;
  • Experience with data visualization tools;
  • Knowledge of cloud computing platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP);
  • Basic understanding of data visualization principles;
  • Basic understanding of SQL and relational databases;
  • Familiarity with machine learning concepts and algorithms;
  • Familiarity with data manipulation and cleaning techniques;
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills;
  • Good communication and teamwork skills. A strong desire to learn and adapt is essential.
  • Fluent Portuguese language skills.

requisitionid:19471

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Short Description

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

MISSION

You will be responsible for developing and implementing data science projects, analyzing large and complex data sets, and driving data-driven decision-making across the organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data science, machine learning, and statistical analysis.

YOUR ROLE


Develop and implement data science projects, including machine learning models, statistical analysis, and data visualization
Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, insights, and opportunities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and translate them into data science solutions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by implementing data validation, testing, and monitoring processes
Stay up-to-date with the latest data science trends and technologies
Contribute to the development of data-driven solutions and products
Present data science findings and recommendations to stakeholders


YOUR PROFILE


2+ years of experience in data science, with a Master's or PhD degree in a related field
Strong knowledge of machine learning, statistical analysis, and data visualization tools and technologies
Experience with big data processing frameworks, such as Spark or Hadoop
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex data sets and identify trends and insights
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
Strong data security and privacy knowledge and experience
Experience with agile development methodologies is a plus


What You’ll Love About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Training and certifications programs.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.


About Capgemini

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Apply now!

Title: Associate Data Scientist 680
Description:
The global data privacy software market is projected to grow from $2.36 billion in 2022 to $25.85 billion by 2029.

So, if you are searching for an innovative career, then the cybersecurity industry might just be the one for you. Protegrity, an international provider of data protection solutions, is looking for new team members who want to make an impact in a company that prioritizes something we all care about: our privacy.

We need people who recognize the opportunity, can plan effectively, take action and execute in the enterprise marketplace with our intuitive, diverse, and future-forward global teams.

So, are you up for collaborating with the best in data security?

Join us on this journey and make an impact with one of the top 25 global software providers. We look forward to making our world become a better place with you on our team.

Apply and discover what’s next today!

Applied scientist

Protegrity is looking for an applied scientist in the field of privacy enhancing technologies. You’ll work in a team of software engineers and machine learning practitioners in designing, building and maintaining applications within the context of data security and data privacy.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain high-quality software applications.
Contribute to continuous development, enhancement and maintenance of existing and new products/features.
Write clean, scalable, and efficient code following industry best practices.
Participate in code reviews to maintain code quality and share knowledge.
Participating in agile practices of the team/organisation as an individual contributor and as a team player.
Research and develop new machine learning based solutions to advance the usability, security and privacy of data at scale.
In the long-term, research and develop new solutions in the field of privacy enhancing technologies and data security.


Qualifications


2-4 years of industry experience.
Deep learning frameworks (preferably Keras and Pytorch) and machine learning algorithms and respective frameworks.
Common data manipulation frameworks (Pandas, NumPy, etc.).
Design and conduct experiments to further improve the performance of machine learning systems.
Strong programming skills with fluency in Python.
Working knowledge of CI/CD best practices.


Why Protegrity


This role offers the opportunity to innovate at the intersection of GenAI safety, privacy, and governance. You will play a pivotal role in helping customers establish trust and compliance in their AI applications while contributing to the company’s technical strategy and industry leadership. Join us in shaping the future of GenAI security.
We offer a highly competitive compensation and benefits package as well as the excitement, challenges, and rewards of a fast-growing, entrepreneurial company.
Become a member of a leading Data and GenAI Protection, Privacy and Security company during one of the best market opportunities to come along in a generation.
Competitive Compensation/Total Reward Packages
Paid Time Off (PTO)
Work on global projects with diverse, energetic, team members who respect each other and celebrate differences.


Working Model


This role is available as a hybrid role. You will work out of your home and be in office 2-3 days a week to attend on-site meetings and working sessions based on business needs. In certain circumstances, the work model may change to accommodate business needs.


We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits with generous vacation and holiday time off. All employees are also provided access to ongoing learning & development.

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace is our priority. We are committed to an environment of acceptance where you are free to bring your full self to work. All qualified applicants and current employees will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Please reference Section 12: Supplemental Notice for Job Applicants in our Privacy Policy to inform you of the categories of personal information that we collect from individuals who inquire about and/or apply to work for Protegrity USA, Inc., or its parent company, subsidiaries or affiliates, and the purposes for which we use such personal information.

Title: Senior Applied Scientist
Description:
✨ About Us ✨

Photoroom was launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our mission is clear: to create the best visuals for your commerce.

Photoroom puts the power of great images into more people's hands through our powerful and innovative features, from our best-in-the-world background remover to our generative AI model and tools: AI Images, AI Backgrounds and Shadows, AI Expand, and many more.

Processing over 5 billion images a year and downloaded over 200 million times, Photoroom is now the world's #1 AI photo-editing app, available across mobile, web, and via an API in over 180 countries.

We are at an exciting stage of our journey. Having successfully raised our Series B, we aim at sustaining 80% YoY growth.

Photoroom is a profitable, remote-friendly company headquartered in Paris with a global team of over 80 world-class deep learning, product, and marketing experts with backgrounds at the world's best companies. We are a diverse team of entrepreneurs building for entrepreneurs.

TL; DR 🤓

Photoroom is looking for a talented Senior Applied Scientist. You will work on several ML solutions, starting from the requirements, literature, all the way to a product. You will own most of this process, be trusted and have your say on data acquisition, optional labelling, overall strategy and follow-ups. Your work will serve millions of users, be useful and be remarked.

💰 Competitive salary + Stock-Options/BSPCE

🇪🇺 We are flexible: you can work from anywhere in Europe within a 3-hour flight from Paris (HQ) and come to our office once a month (fully reimbursed) or more often. This ensures effective collaboration and supports our commitment to reducing our carbon footprint.

✈️ We offer substantial support for relocation (10k€ signing bonus), including finding an apartment in Paris and supporting you with the visa procedure.

💻 Technology - new MacBook Pro, monitor, keyboard, etc.

🏖️ Socials - Quarterly company retreats, weekly Happy Hour & Game Time

🇬🇧 PhotoRoom is an international team and we work in English. We offer language lessons for those who need them (English & French).

✨ About The Role ✨


You'll be the ninth engineer in the ML team, working alongside great talent from various backgrounds.
You will have full ownership of your ML work streams when applicable, or work with teammates on big topics. You have expertise and ownership; you have a say in how that goes.
You will master the whole pipeline, from training models to putting them into production and monitoring their performance.
You will work on new features, new applications, and some 0→1 solutions.
You will get fast feedback from our users and will iterate quickly. You will follow the usage of the product and make decisions based on that.
You will work within a small multicultural team composed of ~75 passionate, friendly & committed folks.


✨ About You ✨


You have 3+ years of experience with PyTorch, Tensorflow or Jax, and are willing to start or keep working with PyTorch.
You have a deep experience with diffusion models, for image creation or edition**.** You’ve trained diffusion models from scratch, or practiced deep surgery beyond their original pre-training.
You are always the most pragmatic person in the room.
You favor speed of iteration over perfect, always leverage frameworks and libraries to avoid reinventing the wheel.
You have experience working on products requiring complex architectures.
You have a strong sense of ownership.
You take initiative and you are at ease to make product & technical decisions.
You have worked as part of a talented team and have experience in a fast-growing startup.
You’re curious, are comfortable with explaining or learning depending on the situation. The team has deep expertise and values knowledge sharing and humility.
You are fluent in English (French is not required!).


✨ Hiring Process ✨


Screening call with our Head of AI
Home technical assignment, reviewed with the team
Culture fit interview and meet the team!
Reference check & Offer


Support - If you have a medical condition or an individual need for an adjustment to our process, and you believe this may affect your ability to be at your best - please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support you and make any adjustments that may be needed.

🌈 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging

We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at the workplace. We believe both the company and its culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's why:


We have flexible working hours
We trust people to work remotely
We extended the length of the parental leave


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.


Show more
HTML:
✨ About Us ✨

Photoroom was launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our mission is clear: to create the best visuals for your commerce.

Photoroom puts the power of great images into more people's hands through our powerful and innovative features, from our best-in-the-world background remover to our generative AI model and tools: AI Images, AI Backgrounds and Shadows, AI Expand, and many more.

Processing over 5 billion images a year and downloaded over 200 million times, Photoroom is now the world's #1 AI photo-editing app, available across mobile, web, and via an API in over 180 countries.

We are at an exciting stage of our journey. Having successfully raised our Series B, we aim at sustaining 80% YoY growth.

Photoroom is a profitable, remote-friendly company headquartered in Paris with a global team of over 80 world-class deep learning, product, and marketing experts with backgrounds at the world's best companies. We are a diverse team of entrepreneurs building for entrepreneurs.

TL; DR 🤓

Photoroom is looking for a talented Senior Applied Scientist. You will work on several ML solutions, starting from the requirements, literature, all the way to a product. You will own most of this process, be trusted and have your say on data acquisition, optional labelling, overall strategy and follow-ups. Your work will serve millions of users, be useful and be remarked.

💰 Competitive salary + Stock-Options/BSPCE

🇪🇺 We are flexible: you can work from anywhere in Europe within a 3-hour flight from Paris (HQ) and come to our office once a month (fully reimbursed) or more often. This ensures effective collaboration and supports our commitment to reducing our carbon footprint.

✈️ We offer substantial support for relocation (10k€ signing bonus), including finding an apartment in Paris and supporting you with the visa procedure.

💻 Technology - new MacBook Pro, monitor, keyboard, etc.

🏖️ Socials - Quarterly company retreats, weekly Happy Hour & Game Time

🇬🇧 PhotoRoom is an international team and we work in English. We offer language lessons for those who need them (English & French).

✨ About The Role ✨

  • You'll be the ninth engineer in the ML team, working alongside great talent from various backgrounds.
  • You will have full ownership of your ML work streams when applicable, or work with teammates on big topics. You have expertise and ownership; you have a say in how that goes.
  • You will master the whole pipeline, from training models to putting them into production and monitoring their performance.
  • You will work on new features, new applications, and some 0→1 solutions.
  • You will get fast feedback from our users and will iterate quickly. You will follow the usage of the product and make decisions based on that.
  • You will work within a small multicultural team composed of ~75 passionate, friendly & committed folks.

✨ About You ✨

  • You have 3+ years of experience with PyTorch, Tensorflow or Jax, and are willing to start or keep working with PyTorch.
  • You have a deep experience with diffusion models, for image creation or edition**.** You’ve trained diffusion models from scratch, or practiced deep surgery beyond their original pre-training.
  • You are always the most pragmatic person in the room.
  • You favor speed of iteration over perfect, always leverage frameworks and libraries to avoid reinventing the wheel.
  • You have experience working on products requiring complex architectures.
  • You have a strong sense of ownership.
  • You take initiative and you are at ease to make product & technical decisions.
  • You have worked as part of a talented team and have experience in a fast-growing startup.
  • You’re curious, are comfortable with explaining or learning depending on the situation. The team has deep expertise and values knowledge sharing and humility.
  • You are fluent in English (French is not required!).

✨ Hiring Process ✨

  • Screening call with our Head of AI
  • Home technical assignment, reviewed with the team
  • Culture fit interview and meet the team!
  • Reference check & Offer

Support - If you have a medical condition or an individual need for an adjustment to our process, and you believe this may affect your ability to be at your best - please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support you and make any adjustments that may be needed.

🌈 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging

We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at the workplace. We believe both the company and its culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's why:

  • We have flexible working hours
  • We trust people to work remotely
  • We extended the length of the parental leave

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We are Landskill and we are looking for new members to join our team. If you’re reading this, you already know you want to change your professional life and you have landed in the right place. What are we looking for? People who love technology and, above all, love to learn. And we get it - keeping our team motivated and happy is the key to staying successful. That’s why we’re so dedicated to making sure our work environment is always a top priority. Do you want to work in a transparent company with opportunities tailored to you? Just make sure you have the right skill, and guarantee the perfect project to scale your career.

If you’re a Python Developer and want to be part of a team working to grow together, we’re actively looking for you.

What we’re looking for: Experience as a Python developer Expertise in web services and microservices architecture Experience with Flask or FastAPI, GIT, and Docker Familiarity with Agile methodologies like Scrum Fluent in spoken and written English

What we offer: Close-knit culture based on empathy and inclusion, with guidance from management teams Training and professional/personal development program, along with a career plan tailored to you Feedback culture and performance management system with regular meetings We value new ideas and identifying areas for improvement, so your opinion matters to us Events to get to know each other better and foster team spirit Referral program rewarding your contribution to the team's growth and success Powered by JazzHR
Show more

Title: QA Automation | Lisbon
HTML:
Ritain.io is a Center of Excellence for Automation and Business Agility: Cloud, Quality Assurance Software, Data and AI/ML.

We are made of people, all around the world, with offices and clients around the globe!

Our focus is to craft impactful business outcomes: do more than we're asked, and be better than expected. Deviler with quality and accountability over what we do. We are here to #MakeEpicStuffHappen together.

Right now, we are looking for a QA Automation Engineer to join our #KickAssTeam!

What will you get here?

  • Food Allowance Card
  • Remote work-model (but awesome offices available for you to work from if you wish!)
  • Flexible working hours
  • Nutritional care
  • Mental health benefits
  • Health insurance
  • Flex Benefits Allowance
  • Lots of discounts

What kind of mindset are we looking for?

  • Team player;
  • Good communicator;
  • Goal-oriented;
  • Problem-solving focused;
  • Critical attention to detail;
  • Out-of-the-box thinking while best practices ambassador.

What do you need to bring us?

  • 6+ months of experience in automated testing;
  • Basic knowledge of one or more programming languages (e.g., Ruby, Java, Python, C#, etc.);
  • Familiarity with automation testing tools like Selenium, Appium, Cucumber, Cypress, or Robot Framework;
  • Understanding of Git and Git workflows for basic source control management;
  • Basic knowledge of relational and non-relational databases;
  • Awareness of agile methodologies and some experience working in agile environments;
  • Familiarity with test management tools like XRAY, TestRail, or others;
  • ISTQB Foundation Level accreditation (nice to have);
  • Written and spoken English (intermediate to fluent);
  • Written and spoken Spanish (nice to have).

What do we expect you to do?

  • Work closely with software engineers to develop and apply test suites;
  • Ensure the release of high-quality software in every sprint cycle;
  • Work closely with the clients to define acceptance criteria for new features;
  • Participate in features definition and improvement;
  • Contribute to the definition of specifications for new tools to improve resolving support issues;
  • Generate weekly reports about work progress/blockers.

Join our Tribe of Tribes and get ready to #MakeEpicStuffHappen!

Title: Senior Data Scientist/ML Ops Engineer
Description:
This is a remote position.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Scientist / Senior ML Ops Engineer to join our team. This position plays a crucial support role in managing and resolving questions and issues related to one of our newly developed AI/ML applications.


This position will have a crucial support role in handling questions / support for one of the new applications.
Candidate will be responsible to analyse and identify issues in the newly developed AI/ML application.
Candidate will also be responsible to coordinate the resolution with other (technical and functional) teams.
Candidate will collaborate with business stakeholders to explain the issues in a non-technical manner and the path to resolution.
Ensures quality resolutions and implementations according to the CI/CD process focused around Jenkins, Domino and Sonarcube.
Focus on following technologies & methodologies: Pandas / pyspark / Dash / kedro / yml / sql queries through Python / modeling / feature selection / model validation.


Requirements


Impeccable professional proficiency in English.
7+ years of experience in building and/or maintaing python based ML/AI solutions and data pipelines.
Candidate must have excellent python coding skills to quickly identify issues and work towards a resolution.
High level of expertise in above mentioned technology & methodology stack.
Flexibility in working accross timezones, i.e. willing to shift working hours to accomodate meetings outside of regular working hours.
Experience in working with productivity tools like JIRA / XRAY / Confluence.


Nice to have


Experience in working in a global, complex, multinational organisation in a team spread accross timezones.
Prior exposure to the Pharmaceutical Industry and/or heavily regulated environment.
Scientific Degree/PhD in any pharmaceutical / lifesciences field.
Basic commercial insight as a consultant.


Benefits


Remote work
Food ticket
Health insurance
Training and access to certification vouchers
Work-life balance initiatives
Referral program
Birthday off
Give back day – enjoy a day to give back to society!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist – Scoring Center (M/F)
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action

In practice, your day-to-day


As a Data Scientist in the Scoring Center team, you will undertake projects to build risk prediction models. Your main responsibilities will be:
As part of your modelling projects, you assess the needs expressed, define and propose the adapted deliverables and estimate their burden and time frame through an implementation plan that takes into account the challenges and constraints. You use statistical modelling methods (such as Logistic Regression, Random Forest, Gradient Boosting…), analyze and explain the results
You lead the project, keep track of the schedule and support the implementation and monitoring of the tools issued
As part of the monitoring and optimization of the BNP Paribas Personal Finance score models, you participate in the monitoring campaigns of the scores: generation and analysis of monitoring results, diagnosis and action plan
You are also responsible for conducting or analyzing statistical studies related to risk prediction models. If necessary, you take part in analytical support missions to the Group's international entities and in the processing of audit recommendations relating to the Basel regulatory project
In addition, you actively contribute to the transversal missions of the Scoring Center: technological and methodological watch, regulatory watch, training, analytical support for the Group's international entities

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!


Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the Analytics Hub, an innovative, international and creative team. Our working language is English
You will be in the Scoring Center teams that are made up of 30 Data Scientists that will work with you. The team in Lisbon is new and everyone is growing together. You'll be surrounded by colleagues working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences
We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on-the-job training, online learning and networking opportunities


What do we have to offer you?


This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.


Are you the one we are looking for?


Do you have a Degree in Data Science, Mathematics or Statistics?
Do you have a scientific background and at least 3 years of experience in a statistical or risk environment, preferably modelling in banking or insurance environment?"
Do you have good skills in Python?
Are you proficient in modelling environment or data lab and have a strong knowledge of the main data science libraries?
Do you have experience in machine models industrialization?
Are you able to work on several projects in parallel and are acknowledge for your accuracy?
Are you fluent in oral and written English?
If you recognize yourself in this description, and have a lot of enthusiasm, energy and motivation, then you are the one we are looking for!
We look forward to your application!


Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
HTML:
We are based in Estonia and we operate globally. We love to work remotely and travel the world. Having freedom, ownership and passion for recruitment are key for us.

We hire amazing tech talent for great companies

We coach highly motivated Professionals to get better careers

We empower recruiters to hire more and better Talent.

Do you want to help us to grow?

Hiire is helping CEGID, a European leader in cloud business management, hire a Senior Data Scientist to advance the data science capabilities.

About The Role

CEGID seeks a Senior Data Scientist to develop machine learning models, focusing on building robust models that enhance decision-making processes and drive business intelligence.

You'll be working within the AI Factory dedicated to advancing CEGID's management software through AI innovation. The primary goal is to seamlessly integrate AI features into the product line, either by enhancing functionality and user experience or by recreating user workflows to take full advantage of AI technology.

What You'll Do

  • Lead the design, development, and implementation of machine learning models tailored for finance and accounting applications;
  • Explore and develop generative AI models to address challenges and opportunities in the finance and accounting domain;
  • Collaborate with finance and accounting experts, software engineers, and data engineers to integrate machine learning solutions into existing systems;
  • Demonstrate an interest in and familiarity with MLOps tools and practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and management of machine learning models.

What We're Looking For

  • Advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline;
  • Proven experience (4+ years) in developing and deploying machine learning models, preferably in the finance and accounting domain;
  • Strong programming skills in languages such as Python or R, familiarity with MLOps tools and practices;
  • Experience with generative AI models and/or NLP is a plus.

Why Join Our Client?

  • Attractive and transparent remuneration from recruitment;
  • Annual bonus based on the achievement of individual and company goals;
  • Hybrid work model and flexible working hours;
  • 25 days of vacation per year;
  • Health insurance;
  • Access to online learning platforms and internal academy;
  • Integration into a dynamic, enthusiastic, and constantly growing team.

Ready to take the next step? Apply now and help shape your future, ours, and our clients’ industries’ future!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
SIXT is a global market leader in the mobility space and sets the pace for innovation like nobody else. We are transforming the industry to become fully digitalized and offer our customers an answer to all mobility needs they have. Our vision is: Transform the world moves, because people expect better. Join our Data Science team and make the magic happen. We drive business processes like pricing and many more with the use of sophisticated algorithms. For this purpose, we design, develop and maintain state of the art machine learning models and manifold optimization solvers as well as simulation models. As a member of this team, your work will improve the experience of millions of our customers and have a direct impact on our business results. Apply now and join our journey and become a part of the SIXT family.

YOUR ROLE AT SIXT:


Develop further and maintain a solid infrastructure within the Data Science team, with a focus on DevOps processes and cloud technologies.
Establish and extend tools to automate our Data Science Tech Stack to continuously enhance MLOps processes, including model deployment and data pipelines.
Ensure a reliable and scalable deployment foundation for our Data Science ML models and algorithms and work closely with other departments like cloud infrastructure.
Collaborate effectively with stakeholders from other departments to achieve our business goals.
Build and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools like Terraform to manage cloud resources.
Make data science experiments production-ready, monitored, robust, and scalable



YOUR SKILLS MATTER:


Strong knowledge cloud technologies, ideally in AWS
Solid coding skills in Python and experience with continuous integration/continuous deployment approaches.
Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC), ideally Terraform, is a strong plus
Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker and ideally container orchestration systems such as Kubernetes.
Ideally knowledge in operational deployment of machine learning applications
Ideally knowledge of data engineering, including data modeling, database systems, and ETL processes.
Ideally experience with monitoring and logging tools to detect and diagnose issues in machine learning models and the infrastructure supporting them.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with fluency in English and an appreciation for cultural diversity.



What We Offer


Generous Time Off Enjoy 28 days of vacation, an additional day off for your birthday, and 1 volunteer day per year
Work-Life Balance & Flexibility Benefit from a hybrid working model, flexible working hours, and no dress code
Great Employee Benefits Access discounts on SIXT rent, share, ride, and SIXT+, along with partner discounts
Training & Development Participate in training programs, external conferences, and internal dev & tech talks designed for your personal growth and development
Health & Well-being Private health insurance to support your well-being
Additional Perks Enjoy the Coverflex advantage system to enhance your employee experience



About us:

We are a leading global mobility service provider with sales of €3.07 billion and around 9,000 employees worldwide. Our mobility platform ONE combines our products SIXT rent (car rental), SIXT share (car sharing), SIXT ride (cab, driver and chauffeur services), SIXT+ (car subscription) and gives our customers access to our fleet of 222,000 vehicles, the services of 1,500 cooperation partners and around 1.5 million drivers worldwide. Together with our franchise partners, we are present in more than 110 countries at 2,098 rental stations. At SIXT, a first-class customer experience and outstanding customer service are our top priorities. We focus on true entrepreneurship and long-term stability and align our corporate strategy with foresight. Want to take off with us and revolutionize the world of mobility? Apply now!
Show more
