Title: Lead Developer
Description:
Join a community of IT enthusiasts at Olisipo, where we don't just create solutions - we revolutionize them. With a track record spanning over 30 years, we've honed our expertise in nurturing talent. Discover a workplace where your potential knows no bounds!




Reporting to the Innovation & IT Projects Department of the client, your role is to ensure that the projects you lead meet the needs and challenges of the business units and deliver the added value expected by the company.




🏠 𝗛𝘆𝗯𝗿𝗶𝗱 (3 days office).

📌 𝗟𝗶𝘀𝗯𝗼𝗻 (𝗢𝗻𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 𝗯𝗮𝘀𝗲𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗴𝗮𝗹 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗯𝗲 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘀𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗱).

🗣️𝗙𝗹𝘂𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗶𝗻 𝗘𝗻𝗴𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗵




Your missions:

Manage the Developers.
Achieve project goals by respecting quality, deadlines, and technical choices defined by the IT department.
Participate in daily operations (RUN).
Contribute to the continuous improvement of development processes. • Adhere to the testing practices defined by management.
Create or maintain project documentation.
Apply the methodology implemented by the department.




Tech stack:

.Net
C#
SQL
Azure DevOps
Azure Functions
Angular
AGILE methodology using SCRUM and KANBAN frameworks.




Profile:

With a Bac +5/Engineering in Computer Science – Project Management degree, you have at least 5 years of successful experience in a Developer role/management, with a proven track record of accomplishments.
Result-oriented, but not only, you are recognized for your precision and enthusiasm.
You know how to listen and communicate effectively with both internal and external clients.
You have already led and managed teams in project mode.
During your integration, you will benefit from a training and onboarding period that combines practical and theoretical phases, allowing you to better understand the specifics of our business.




We offer:

Personal accompaniment focused on Career Management;
Continuous and personalized Training and Certification through our own Learning Center;
Solidity;
Trust and Growth;
Competitive salary package with benefits.




Apply now and get to know this project! 📩

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal
HTML:
A SynchroTech recruta Software Engineer para empresa da área soluções de logística, localizada em Vila Nova de Gaia.

FUNÇÃO

  • Participação no desenvolvimento de soluções inovadoras;
  • Desenvolvimento de software de gestão para sistema automáticos, nomeadamente WMS (Warehouse Management System);
  • Desenvolvimento de software de emulação e simulação;
  • Realização de testes em fábrica;
  • Participação nos testes em obra;
  • Execução de documentação técnica;
  • Serviço de assistência aos sistemas instalados.

LOCAL E HORÁRIO

  • Vila Nova de Gaia;
  • Regime presencial, com 1 dia teletrabalho;
  • 40h/semanais.

REQUISITOS

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Ciências da Computação ou similar (preferencial);
  • Experiência de, pelo menos, 3 anos na função ou em funções semelhantes;
  • Mínimo de 3 anos de experiência em desenvolvimento de software, de preferência em sistemas WMS;
  • Experiência com Base de dados SQL Server e Transact-SQL;
  • Conhecimentos de .Net 8 LTS;
  • Conhecimentos de linguagens de programação e frameworks, nomeadamente Blazor, JavaScript, css, json, ajax, xml;
  • Experiência com arquitetura orientada a eventos (Masstransit ou outros);
  • Competência de React, Angular;
  • Valorizados conhecimentos em Unity;
  • Bom nível de inglês (B2);
  • Disponibilidade para deslocações.

CONDIÇÕES

  • Contrato direto com o cliente;
  • Seguro de saúde;
  • Integração numa equipa jovem e dinâmica.

Os candidatos interessados devem submeter o CV atualizado.

SynchroTech by Egor

Success through People

Os candidatos considerados serão contactados num prazo máximo de 10 dias úteis

Title: Software Engineer - Back end
Description:
THE ROLE
We are looking for a Software Engineer who is motivated to build world-class applications using top notch technology. You will be working in a very friendly and relaxed environment and be part of a well-motivated, talented and growing team. If you love to learn, if you are willing to share knowledge and would love to be part of the building process to reach the top, using the latest technology stack and having fun doing it, this is an opportunity you can’t miss.

What You’ll Do


Evolve our e-commerce platform, defining its future
Work with a product development team evolving the platform capabilities and ensuring performance and scalability;
Expand our microservices architecture, creating new services
Evolve your technical capabilities to the next level while using state-of-the-art technologies (.Net, SQL Server, MongoDB, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes etc)
Mentor and support the growth of other team members
Cooperate with other teams to assure the technical feasibility of the scope of the projects





Who You Are


An expert in object oriented languages (C# or Java)
Knowledgeable of unit tests and/or integration tests
Passionate about code quality
Stay on top of all of all best practices of modern software development
Knowledgeable of SQL and experience using relational databases
Knowledgeable of REST APIs
Experienced in NoSQL databases and SOA architecture is a plus
A professional with experience working with agile methodologies is also a plus
Autonomous and able to make important technical decisions that will have a positive impact on our platform
Interested in large-scale systems
Passionate about solving complex problems





Rewards & Benefits


Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program





EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT


Farfetch is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, gender identity, ancestry, sexual orientation, veteran status, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.





SCAM DISCLAIMER


It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process





We are looking for a Software Engineer who is motivated to build world-class applications using top notch technology.

What You’ll Do

  • Evolve our e-commerce platform, defining its future
  • Work with a product development team evolving the platform capabilities and ensuring performance and scalability;
  • Expand our microservices architecture, creating new services
  • Evolve your technical capabilities to the next level while using state-of-the-art technologies (.Net, SQL Server, MongoDB, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes etc)
  • Mentor and support the growth of other team members
  • Cooperate with other teams to assure the technical feasibility of the scope of the projects




Who You Are

  • An expert in object oriented languages (C# or Java)
  • Knowledgeable of unit tests and/or integration tests
  • Passionate about code quality
  • Stay on top of all of all best practices of modern software development
  • Knowledgeable of SQL and experience using relational databases
  • Knowledgeable of REST APIs
  • Experienced in NoSQL databases and SOA architecture is a plus
  • A professional with experience working with agile methodologies is also a plus
  • Autonomous and able to make important technical decisions that will have a positive impact on our platform
  • Interested in large-scale systems
  • Passionate about solving complex problems




Rewards & Benefits

  • Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
  • Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
  • Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
  • Flexible benefits program




EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT

  • Farfetch is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, gender identity, ancestry, sexual orientation, veteran status, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.




SCAM DISCLAIMER

  • It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process




We are looking for a Software Engineer who is motivated to build world-class applications using top notch technology.

Title: Umbraco Developer
Description:
Company Description

A Alter Solutions Portugal é uma empresa de Consultoria em Tecnologia da Informação, catalisadora da Transformação Digital, integrante do grupo Alter Solutions criado em 2006, em Paris.

Em 2022, a Alter Solutions integrou o grupo act digital, constituindo uma comunidade global de talento em Tecnologia, com presença em treze países: Alemanha, Bélgica, Brasil, Canadá, Estados Unidos da América, Marrocos, México, Espanha, França, Luxemburgo, Polónia, Portugal e Sérvia. Também em 2023, fomos certificados como um Great Place to Work©.

Em Portugal, contamos com 120 clientes e uma equipa de 500 pessoas, a trabalhar em projetos de setores tão diversos como Banca, Seguros, Transportes, Aviação e Energia.

Sede do centro de IT Nearshore, conta com uma equipa dedicada com cerca de 30 profissionais especializados, integrados em projetos com diversos clientes de renome internacional.

Job Description

Estamos à procura de Consultores(as) Mid-Level com experiência comprovada em Umbraco para integrar a nossa equipa dinâmica e altamente especializada. Se tens pelo menos 3 anos de experiência com este CMS, fluência mínima em inglês (B1) e disponibilidade praticamente imediata, esta pode ser a oportunidade certa para ti!

Requisitos Essenciais:


Experiência prática e comprovada com Umbraco (mínimo 3 anos).
Conhecimentos sólidos em ASP.NET, C#, HTML, CSS, e JavaScript para personalizações e integrações no Umbraco.
Capacidade de análise e resolução de problemas técnicos em projetos baseados em Umbraco.
Inglês nível B1 (mínimo), com capacidade para comunicar de forma clara em contextos profissionais.
Disponibilidade para integração imediata ou em curto prazo.


Responsabilidades:


Participar no desenvolvimento, personalização e manutenção de projetos baseados em Umbraco.
Colaborar com as equipas de desenvolvimento para garantir a entrega de soluções de alta qualidade.
Fazer a interface com os clientes em deslocações pontuais, sempre que necessário.
Garantir que os prazos e requisitos do cliente sejam cumpridos de forma eficiente.

Title: Python Developer - Counterparty Risk
Description:
About The Job

BNP Paribas’ RISK department is in charge of supporting the definition of the risk appetite and risk decision-making process of the Group.

RISK Global Services teams is part of RISK, and aims to transversally develop optimized resources, platforms and common services that are adding value for all of RISK. Their activities cover transversally market, counterparty, credit and liquidity related topics. They assume their responsibilities in full cooperation with either RISK Business Domains or Global Practice teams, or else with subsidiaries or branches of the corresponding RISK teams.

RISK Systems is part of RISK Global Services, and at Group level is responsible for risk capital markets IT systems. It combines development, business analysis (BA) and process reengineering skills as well as coordination support for innovation. Through its experience and polyvalent profiles (IT/Functional), RISK Systems is supporting the Counterparty Credit Risk Computation services in their continuous transformation, with an attention point on securing the transfer of new developments into production as the production frameworks are becoming more and more strictly governed.

With over 250 members across 10 countries, RISK Systems works in a fully Scaled Agile setup and you will be part of a squad following SAFE agile practices, working closely with other locations, in a multicultural environment.

Innovation is also key to RISK Systems and you will have the opportunity to collaborate in cross-team innovation projects and propose initiatives aligned with our top innovation priorities: Process Efficiency & Automation and Knowledge Sharing.

Your Main Activities Are


Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable and reliable Python code
Rapidly prototyping solutions to quickly prove/disprove new concepts
Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the applications
Incrementally deliver applications to meet dynamic customer requirements
Resolve incidents in a production environment
Collaborate with different stakeholders in the solution of problems and blockages


Profile And Skills To Success

Minimum Qualification Requirements:


Academic degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics or related field
Proven experience with Python programming


Valued Technical And Functional Skills


Solid understanding of object-oriented programming and functional programming paradigms
Proficient in Python, with a good knowledge of its ecosystem and architectural patterns
Experience with SQL and any industry standard relational database
Experience with unit, integration and end to end testing
Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application
Familiar with Agile/SAFE practices is a plus
A good understanding of the Financial markets is a plus


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: QA Tester (Python+AWS)
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • 3+ years of experience in quality assurance testing;
  • Experience with testing automation tools including Python, Swagger, Flask, Github;
  • Experience with AWS;
  • Experience with Jira and Confluence;
  • Experience with front end testing as well as APIs and data sets;
  • Fluent in English;
  • Hybrid regime in Porto.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: Hybrid;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • Lounge;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at andre.b.eufrasio@aubay.pt.


We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.

Title: Cloud Engineer
HTML:
A Ankix, referência em competências tecnológicas, especialista em IT Outsourcing e Consultoria / Desenvolvimento à medida, oferece soluções com qualidade e inovação! Estamos lado a lado com os nossos consultores & clientes, dedicados às suas necessidades e objetivos.


Queres dar o próximo grande passo na tua carreira?


Temos uma oportunidade em aberto para um perfil de Cloud Engineer Azure para um dos nossos clientes no Porto. O nosso cliente é uma empresa portuguesa especializada em soluções digitais e serviços de IT com presença global e oferece suporte a empresas e organizações na sua transformação digital, focando-se em criar valor por meio de tecnologias inovadoras e personalizadas.


Requisitos:

- Licenciatura em Informática, Tecnologia da Informação, ou áreas semelhantes;

- Experiência mínima de 3 anos na área;

- Conhecimento e experiência em ambientes virtualizados;

- Conhecimento sobre os serviços Azure e as suas funcionalidades;

- Experiência em Cloud Azure e AKS (Azure Kubernetes Services);

- Inglês Fluente;


Se és um especialista em busca de novos desafios e queres fazer parte de uma empresa que valoriza o teu talento, candidata-te para esta vaga!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is fully integrated in the global organization of Natixis, a French multinational financial services firm specialized in Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate & Investment Banking, Insurance and Payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, Natixis counts nearly 16.000 employees across 38 countries.

Based in Porto, Natixis Centre of Expertise mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the bank’s business, operations and work culture worldwide, as a key driver of the company’s culture of agility and innovation. Teams of IT and Banking Support Activities work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting all the business lines and country platforms.

Natixis in Portugal is the best combination of a “start-up mindset” with a large, solid structure. Its unique culture gives true meaning to a “beyond banking” personality: to be a real entrepreneur, self-challenging, ever striving to excel and go that extra mile.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

As part of the Finance Direction, you will integrate the Financial Data Integrity department (FDI) which oversees the labelling of financial data for CIB activities of Natixis (balance sheet and off-balance sheet).

You will join a team of 6 people in Porto.

As a Senior Data Analyst, of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:


Support Data Management initiatives for Internal & Regulatory framework toward improvement of the quality of reports produced by Natixis CIB.
Participate in the Data monitoring for CIB activities (Financing, Global market, etc.)


You will be in contact with the other teams of FDI, internal Finance partners and Finance IT teams.

Main tasks and goals:

As a Senior Data Analyst, your primary tasks will be:

1- Data Systems and Analytics:


Develop solutions for data extraction, exploration, and transformation using SQL and other technologies.
Interface between business line and IT to translate business requirements into data sources and queries, supporting the creation of KPI metrics for dashboards.
Design and implement data architectures, along with new dashboards, to enhance business intelligence capabilities.
Manage and improve the use of data visualization tools like Power BI, ensuring the effective presentation of data to stakeholders;.
Own the creation and maintenance of scheduled reporting, including Power BI dashboards, to regularly inform business decisions.


2- Requirements and Coordination:


Oversee the full lifecycle of business requirements, from elicitation and analysis to documentation, management, and solution translation.
Plan and conduct workshops, interviews, and prototyping sessions to collect, clarify, and confirm business requirements.
Coordinate with Finance IT to monitor and prioritize the remediation plans and overall business requirements.
Ensure the effective coordination and implementation of financial issues remediation with relevant committees and IT teams.


3- Data Governance and Strategy (Technical View & Impact):


Participate in the coordination of the Data Domain Office (DDO) network for finance, including involvement in framework committees and data quality frameworks for projects regarding all technical requests.
Contribute to the strategic planning of Data Management roadmap, aiming to align data management practices with business objectives regarding the technical impact.


4- Monitoring and Collaboration:


Monitor the implementation of business requirements and data strategies in collaboration with IT teams.
Support the management and enhancement of data visualization and BI solutions, fostering a culture of data-driven decision making.
Collaborate with various teams to promote cross-functional unity and ensure the seamless integration of technical data insights into business processes.


Additional information:

You will be part of a bi-localized team with a local manager and a functional manager based in Paris, with regular interactions with the Paris team.

The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

Qualifications:


Master’s degree in Finance, Math, Data Analytics, Data Science or Data Engineering;
Understanding of Data Governance and Data Management;
Knowledge in BCBS239 and the respective Streams;
Experienced with Finance / Banking Data (Banking environment, regulations, and products)
Advance expertise in Power BI and Tableau is essential, building automated reports and creating data-driven dashboards;
Knowledge of data transformation and analysis tools (Power Query, DAX, Excel, SQL and Python)
Synthesize complex datasets into clear, efficient, fast, useful, and appealing visualizations, dashboards and reports;
Knowledge in Big Data environments and technical tools for data analysis;
Experience with Atlassian Jira (as a plus);
Experience with Power BI Report Builder, Power Automate, and Power Apps (as a plus);
English (mandatory) and French (as a plus).


Soft Skills:


Strong communication and relationship-building skills;
Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities and attention to details;
Understand Business requirement and suggest right architecture;
Curious, proactive, and able to work in a fast-paced environment;
Teamwork orientation and coaching skills to foster a collaborative atmosphere.


Only CV´s in English will be considered.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.

Title: Backend Developer
Description:
You’ll be focused in


Developing cloud and micro service business solutions on different platforms that combine user needs with business requirements and ensure technical feasibility.
Concepting development, architectural reviews, development and operations
Developing, deploying and maintaining automotive backend microservices based on Java, JavaScript or Python and powered by AWS
Working in the context of automotive, you will use DevOps principles to create, test and deploy backend solutions as well as internal tools using modern cloud infrastructure like AWS
Contributing to tech and architecture decisions
Contributing with your team and other teams on all questions around backend and tool development.



In order to succeed, you’ll need


Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or comparable work experience
Proven experience working as a Backend Developer or related role
Experience with backend development with Java and others such as Node.js, focusing on RESTful APIs, event driven architecture and integration (Kafka), and testing (JUnit, Mockito, ElasticMQ or similar)
Experience with tools for logging and monitoring
Knowledge of Cloud environments
Knowledge of database design
Strong Communication and analytical skills
Great English skills, both written and spoken



Nice to Have:


Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) such as Terraform or Cloudformation or CDK
Experience in Microservices



About The Product

TMS main goal is to enable processes and IT systems in MAN's Production and Logistics for the cross-brand product development, within the TRATON Group, contributing for the implementation of the modular system for trucks and buses.

Company Benefits


1200€ to equip your home office
720€ gross/year home allowance
Performance bonus
Health insurance extendable to your household
Wellbeing program extendable to your household
Life insurance
Pension fund
Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)



Cool Things You’ll Experience In Our Work Environment


Tailored remote-friendly setup for every team's vibe!
Flexible working hours
Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
Pet friendly environment
Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding



About VWDS

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) we are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. We make sure that our products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! 🚗

Title: Developer Murex
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines – Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management – and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

Business environment

Within the Natixis IT GMR-BPT-Transaction Regulatory Reporting team, we manage the Transaction Regulatory Reporting on different regulations for:


Real time and End of Day report on Commodity Trades
Real time reports on FX Trades


Process environment

Main Responsibilities:


Design, develop and maintain regulatory aspects inside Murex
Debug, analyze and bug fixing
Provide help to production team to resolve incident
Participate to developing a new solution for the regulatory reports


Mission

The mission will be, under the control of a project leader, to:


Participate to the regulatory projects: designing and developing solutions.
Write technical specifications
Collaborate with team members in Paris and Porto in order to validate changes.
Take in charge the management of development and UAT environments
Support production team in a delivery steps
Knowledge of CICD process
Agile knowledge required


Qualifications

Qualifications

Technical skills:


Script, Shell, KSH
XML, XSL, XSLT
Java
Murex Datamart
SQL, Oracle
Unix, Windows
Bitbucket, Git, Jira, Jenkins, Xray
XL release, XL deploy, CtrlM
C2X


Personal qualities:


Autonomous, Responsible, Proactive and Organized while having the ability to adapt
Team player
Good analytical and synthesis skills
Good communication
Interest in the financial markets
Will to get more experience by extending his business knowledge


Languages:


English: confirmed level


Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant’s gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto’s most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour

Title: Full-stack Developer
Description:
Our client develops the laboratory management solution, which allows users to manage the processes and devices inside their battery testing laboratories.

This application is in use within several large companies, and the goal of the work described here is to accelerate development based on the needs of our key users.

The application is an intranet solution with a web frontend.

What you’ll be doing

Ensure the database schema is kept up-to-date by writing and executing database migrations for any required schema changes
Ensure efficient database performance, handle database related events, and ensure the integrity of data across different services
Write unit tests and integration tests to ensure the correct functionality of REST APIs, backend (micro)services communication, and database interactions
Develop and implement responsive user interfaces that align with the current design and style of the application
Develop and execute E2E tests and unit tests to verify the functionality and performance of the entire user interface
Participate in code review
Participate in dailies, refinements and estimation sessions
Keep documentation and changelog up to date

What you should bring:

Experience with web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Browser development)
Front-end experience with Angular (>=2, ideally a recent version)
Experience with JavaScript and/or TypeScript
Experience with REST APIs
Experience with Node.js, experience with NestJS is helpful
Experience with MongoDB
Experience using Docker, Kubernetes to deploy code
Experience in automated software testing, ideally Cypress, Jasmine
Linux as well as version control systems (ideally Git)
Knowledge of bootstrap CSS framework is a plus

What we’ll hook you up with:

Your well-being matters: you will get flextime and support for your personal needs
You get access to a time bank: you can take time off when needed and add time to make up for the “time loan”
We value your initiative and we create opportunities for you to evolve professionally. This includes workshops, conferences, e-learning platforms and certifications
We care about each other, joys and challenges alike. There’s always someone you can share a laugh, a problem, or a story with
Other goodies that support a good life-work balance: private medical insurance, team activities, and more.

Show more

Title: Mobile Developer
Place: Vila Nova de Famalicão, Braga, Portugal
Description:
🚀 Estamos à procura de um Mobile Developer!📱




És apaixonado por desenvolvimento mobile e queres trabalhar em projetos inovadores? Então esta oportunidade é para ti!

Na YouOn Group, desenvolvemos soluções digitais de alto impacto, criando experiências mobile que fazem a diferença. Procuramos um Mobile Developer para se juntar à nossa equipa e ajudar-nos a criar as melhores soluções.




O que vais fazer?

Desenvolvimento e manutenção de aplicações mobile 
Criação de interfaces user-friendly 
Debugging das aplicações
Desenvolvimento em ambientes Agile 




O que procuramos em ti?

Formação base em Engenharia Informática ou equivalente
Experiência mínima de 1 ano em desenvolvimento mobile (iOS e/ou Android)
Conhecimentos consolidados de React Native
Bons conhecimentos em desenvolvimento frontend (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)
Interesse por projetos UI/UX
Interesse por projetos escaláveis
Boa capacidade de organização
Bom nível de Inglês




O que oferecemos?

Remuneração alinhada com a experiência
Oportunidade de trabalhar numa equipa dinâmica e criativa
Folga no dia de aniversário
Possibilidade de crescimento profissional
Acesso gratuito ao ginásio
Ambiente de trabalho flexível e colaborativo




Local: Vila Nova de Famalicão

 

🎯 Pronto para este desafio?

Candidata-te agora!

Title: Junior Java Developer
Description:
We are looking for a rising start in Java Development who wants to join our growing team in Porto and be part of a group of +200 teammates who are passionate about data.




What we offer you:

By joining us you will…

· Be joining a global team considered by industry specialists (e.g. Gartner) as one of the World Top20 best companies in the field of Data Management and a team awarded on the top5 “Best Places to Work” in Portugal.

· Have opportunity to have a practical and intense initial training supported by experienced developers that will support your integration

· Be part of a project team with experienced developers that will guide and support you

· Participate in Java Software development of state-of-the-art Data Platforms

· Implementing data management solutions for world leading international companies.




Some of the advantages of working with us..

· Flexible working schedule and ability to work in a hybrid mode (5 times in the office per month; 6 weeks a year fully remote from wherever you agree on)

· Competitive salary with benefits

· Be supported by a senior consultant (mentor) that will help in your career development

· A team spirit that will make you feel at home

· Be part of a team located in 3 different continents where diversity is as common as the air your breath




You are...

Mandatory soft skills: Dynamic and full of enthusiasm to know more and deliver better, who enjoys working in a team and is comfortable communicating with team mates and feels at ease on seeking for help.
Mandatory: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Mandatory Knowledge: perfectly fluent in English
Preferable: experience at working with Agile
Preferable: You have knowledge in environments/frameworks/tools such as (or similar to) Eclispe; IntelliJ, Hibernate, Spring; Maven
Preferable: You understand the concepts around Databases







Who are we?

Apgar is a leading company in the development and implementation of data platforms, recognized by analysts as one of the world leaders in this area.

We support our clients in their digital transformation, through the global team that has more than 200 consultants in our offices located in Europe (Portugal, UK, France, Switzerland, Cyprus), The Americas (USA and Brazil), Middle East (Lebanon) and South Asia and Oceania (Singapore and Australia).

Our consultants work on developing Master Data Management, Data Governance, Data Integration, Advanced Data Analytics and Machine Learning solutions among others.




Let's talk about your future in the world of data management software?




We firmly believe in an ethical approach to recruitment, where every candidate is treated with consideration, fairness, and transparency throughout the selection process, with the aim of respecting diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities.

Show more
